description: What a wonderful , fun evening in San Francisco. The description in previous reviews are accurate. It's the Hot Boxx Girls that made the night. Lovely , sassy and talented we loved that we were right next to the ladies. Nice banter with the audience and stayed after the show for photos. Make a reservation and enjoy the show.
author: Salle M.

description: Scuzzy dive bar in the heart of the Tenderloin so be mindful of thieves and cockroaches. Old bartender with a ponytail argues with the customers so clearly doesn't know what customer service is. He also uses the same glass when makes you a second cocktail, literally chucking the ice and straw from your first drink into a garbage pail. Not an enjoyable experience.
author: Thom B.

description:
Wouldn't come back here if someone paid me. The MC shamed us constantly on the mic for not tipping, even though we were. Referred to our group of nine, who were all in town for a bachelorette party, as "dumb white girls" 
Not all of us were white, or women. I get that drag queens are suppose to be funny and play with the audience, but we were literally being shamed and made to feel uncomfortable the entire time we were there. As a member of the LGBT family it was sad to see a place like this, in San Fran of all places, representing us in such a shitty light. Also, the drinks are cheap, yes, but you are most likely not getting what you pay for. We ordered Tito's and soda all night and it definitely tasted like the shittiest vodka you could find in a gas station for $4.99 a bottle.
author: Rue H.

description: Very small venue! I mean the intimacy isn't a bad thing,  but on those awesome high fantasy Tuesday nights full of fabulous drag,  it's literally a drag because it can get crowded af! The first and last time I came here all in the same day was an amazing experience overall,  but I just wish it was a lil mo bigger to let us fans see a great show these kweens put on!
author: Mark L.

description: Horrible! We paid $5 each to get in and we were told to step away from the bar and couldn't even order a drink.
author: Rebecca S.

description:
Such an incredibly, unique, warm and friendly place. I feel so at home when I enter the door. 
The Tuesday night High Fantasy event has a diverse and unique base of changing artistic talent.  I only worry that this place will become too popular and its vibe will change. Myles, the DJ on Tuesday nights is pretty special.
author: Susie S.

description: This place had a $5 cover and was so boring and bad...no amount of alcohol could make it good.. bad drag....
author: Mark F.

description: We came in with a group of people who were ready to spend money and have a fun time with their fabulous performers. For whatever reason they were hostile to our group from the moment we walked through the door. We were so excited to be there and support their establishment but we got nothing rude and angry customer service.
author: Rachel T.

description:
This is an interesting Gay bar. It's old. Yet it has a rich history, having been around long enough to recall the harsh reality of LGBT suffering & rejection, thanks to society's "norms." Watching the American Psychiatric Assoc discard homosexuality as a 'Mental Illness' from its' Psychiatric Diagnosis (DSMIII). And still here now, celebrating LGBT liberty, freedom & Marriage Equality. 
How do I know this? It's only my 1st visit. B/C of the ppl inside. I stopped in for a look-see. I ended up staying much later than planned. I was greeted warmly, treated like family. Truths were shared. 
The drinks are a good pour - I'll betcha best prices in S.F.  No food. You can bring your food in & eat there. The bar seems to celebrate anything! "Christmas in July" going on now. I was told Aunt Charlie's regularly have Live Drag shows & Entertainment. 
I'd give 5, ...but one star removed as it is a in a troubled area. That makes me sad.
author: Van H.

description:
Words to describe Aunt Charlie's: Glitter, whiskey sours, Ke$ha, fabulous!!!

A fabulous time if you are not expecting anything fancy, but you want to boogie without judgment and witness a talented group of queens of all ages shaking their thing and having fun. The queens rotate over the years but Miss Rahni steals the show with her wicked moves and red sparkly lips. The queens definitely work for their tips and are not shy, make sure to bring lots of cash! Drinks are cheap and stiff, a good time for bachelorette party or a Friday night cheap thrill! Classic San Francisco local favorite.
author: Amanda C.

description:
Hey Aunt Charlie, You are one of my favorite aunt now!
Heck, how could you not with all the glitters of sassy drag queens and the heaviest hand bartender! $4 for a strong screwdriver?! Wait, I'm still in SF right??

This is not your young and sexy drag queen show. This is the classic, dirty, and sassy drag show. There were laughter and dollar bills on the air. (Bring the dollar bills and share the love. Be respectful, for the love of the wig God, you do not want to anger a drag queen!)
Fun night and good divey bar to pregame. Seriously, cheap heavy drink!!!

PS: If you call the place to reserve the seat for the show and nobody pick up...keep calling!
The bartender has a hearing problem, so it may take a few tries before he picks up.
author: Jenny T.

description: Just walking through the Tenderloin in the middle of the night..following where my friend was leading us. We end up at this sketchy part of town then I paid my $5 cover. I was thinking are you kidding cover to get into a dive bar in the TL!!?? Then I walked in and realized a drag show was happening. I remember sitting there thinking I feel like I'm in a set of s movie. This bar is small dark with red lanterns and a big neon sign and s bartender that looks like a member of the Beegees! And I sure did tell him that's. The characters of the show were great! Some has amazing bodies! I was trying to figure out are those butt implants?? Remember to bring lots of $1 bills to tip.
author: Karen T.

description: So much Fun! Great music and a great show!!!! Fun to be able to just kick back and enjoy! The drinks were ok and they do have a cover charge Cash only! I do recommend to check this place out!
author: J.C. F.

description:
WILD.

San Francisco Dive Bar (definition of it) with a drag queen show. The place has a $5 cover and very cheap (dive style) drinks. You sit along the bar or on the seats on the side. 

You get a long 2 hour show starting at 10pm which although rather trashy, is fun for one time or to bring a non-city native. The ladies are fun and the music is loud. Your snapchat will be off the hook.
author: Nikita K.

description:
Fun place.  I think the tone changes depending on when you go.  I heard that during the day it is mostly regulars from the surrounding neighborhood. During the weekend drag shows it is a more mixed crowd of straights/gays/locals/tourists/bridal parties, etc. Everyone has a good time.  The drinks are strong and cheap.  A mixed drink is $4.75 with lots of booze.  That same drink a block over is $12! Friendly bartender and one I am told who works afternoons who is 91.  Don't let the area put you off.  It's gritty but not "unsafe."

Go early (5 PM to 7:30 PM ish) and there is a really kind, sweet guy (Michael) to the left of the front door a bit with a charcoal grill...fresh BBQ sausages on a bun with Sweet Baby Ray's BBQ sauce, ribs, half chickens, ribeye steaks and various other grilled treats at amazingly low prices.  Sooooo tasty and only $3 or $2 for sausages depending on the type.  Support his business--he's super cool, does not drink, do drugs, etc. and this is his only source of income.  He takes tremendous pride in being able to serve the community fresh grilled meals.  If anything is left unsold he generously shares it with those in need at no cost.  
Great guy! Great food!

Bar and the grill nearby are cash only.
author: John B.

description:
First off... I don't understand why this place has such a high rating... I came here with some friends on a Friday night and didn't realize that reservations were required if you want to sit anywhere. There was a drag show. So, we were confined to the back of the tiny place (near the entrance). Btw this place is a total dive and in a rough area of SF... 

So, my friends and I decided to give the place a chance, see how the drinks are, and see if the drag show was any good. I waited 40 minutes at the bar waiting to order drinks. There was only one bartender and no wait staff...

The drag show was terrible. So, after wasting 45 minutes here we decided to leave. It was a waste of time and a waste of the $5 cover to get in. This place seems like a place for regulars, but a bad choice for newcomers...
author: Jeff N.

description:
Just because this is the top result for "drag show" Yelp searches in SF does not mean it's the best show or group of queens. To clarify, the show was entertaining, but mostly because of the randomness associated with the dual responsibilities that the entertainers take on.

One of the queens is not only 3rd in the show, but also acts as waitress and bar back when the bar is low on ice. Another girl follows her and doubles as DJ (read: has a Discman or older iPod that connects to the bar's speakers). She was a trip because none of her songs were recognizable by the largely gay male and straight fruit flies that were cheering this mess on throughout the night. At one point I swear she was lip synching about bugs (presumably roaches).

The saving grace was that everyone seemed to acknowledge that this was a high-in-the-wall bar with a drag show that would start when they felt like starting. No intermingling with the entertainers behind the screen that separated the public bathrooms with their dressing room.

Cash only and definitely a good place to see some authentic San Francisco grime and myrrh all in one place.
author: David K.

description: This lounge isn't bad. The drinks were cheap, but there was a cover charge when we got there (after 10 pm on a Thursday). The bartender is sassy, but friendly to those who know him. The music was all right--not any pop music. I might come back. I liked how they had a no phone use policy so everyone could just enjoy the night! The bathrooms are horrible, though. No toilet seat and no door covering the stall in the main bathroom. Although there's a private bathroom, it was a longer wait.
author: Tony A.

description:
Wow! Where do I start !
Ok so being from LA the drag scene is super different than this. My best friend and I wanted to try something new and different .i found this place on Yelp and said give it a try.  We took an uber here and we were kinda ehh about the outside and then walked in and we were like ummmmm ok .... Something different... Colette greeted us and walked us over to a table at the end by the "stage". We asked for a 2 drinks.  She came back and said "$10 for both drinks" we were amazed because in LA the drinks we ordered would like of been $9-13 each. Awesome way to start . We arrived around 9pm and it was empty but mid way through our drink the house was packed. We ordered more drinks (margaritas) omg were they strong (yasssssssssss) then the show started. If you love Old Sassy Broads this is the place to come ! It's an absolute treat ! The performances were nothing like LA but so much more entertaining! You have to come at least once in your life. 2nd and 4th Wednesday's are the nights to come! The drinks amazing strong and cheap I will definitely be coming back!  the house was full of young diverse tourist who all were coming for a good time and it definitely was a good time. Aunt Charlie you are the aunt I always wanted !
author: Gilbert N.

description: This wont let me give ZERO stars! This place is owned by a straight guy & will put up with homophobic anti-gay behavior from straight men towards gay men. Truly unbelievable in San Francisco! I can't believe they are proud that "owned by a straight man" & "most of our money comes from straight people" is an answer to allowing a straight man to abuse a gay man with "you shouldn't be wiggling like that it's disgusting" among other angry rants. I've never experienced a more apolitical group of "gay" men ever.  It hurt my heart.
author: Wesley S.

description: 5 bucks for a drag show, not bad. The drinks are made pretty strong too, I dig it.
author: Luke S.

description:
So. Much. Fun!!!!!!!!!!!! 

I wasn't quite sure what to expect... walking in its definitely a 70's style dive that hasn't really upgraded since then. It smelled vaguely of urine in places and it's super tiny. That being said, the bartender had a heavy pour and the drinks were east-coast-cheap which made any other unpleasantness completely null and void. 

The show started at 10, and my god, what a show. This is not an Asia-SF show, this is a "wow, is this real life?" kind of night. There is no stage, the performers are right next to you seated at the bar or in the chairs they have lined up against the wall. It's a real up-close and personal show -- just couldn't be more perfect. 

10/10, I want to take everyone I know to this place.
author: Kate D.

description:
Come for the drag queens, stay for the cheap drinks and heavy handed bar tender! Strongest drinks I've had in a while!!!
The drag queens were fantastic and hilarious. Collette LeGrande was fabulous, a great entertainer who perfectly and professionally dealt with an unruly guest who ended up getting kicked out later. We also loved Olivia Hart and greatly hope that she wins the grand dutchess election! 
We will definitely come back, I can't wait to bring my hubs!
author: Barbara Dee B.

description: i went to aunt charlie's on a thursday night to get some drinks & catch up with friends. my pst experiences with aunt charlie's have always been positive but tonight was different. thursday night is a "no cell phone night" which i did my best to respect and abide by. HOWEVER. when the night was ended & i went to call a lyft i was immediately told to "turn off your cell phone bitch" by an aunt charlie's employee. when i tried to explain that i was trying to call a lyft to leave & didn't feel safe calling it outside, i was immediately brushed off. i walked to the front of the bar thinking i would be less disruptive with my phone on there & i was immediately reprimanded by a different aunt charlie's employee about my phone & told to go outside. all i wanted to do was go home & wait for a couple minutes in a safe space & i was made to feel like an unwelcome nuisances. aunt charlie's, if this is the way you run your business, you are only a safe space for cis-males & all female or non-binary people should wary of a place that has so little compassion for their customers well being
author: Jana G.

description:
First I was like wtf!?

Then I was like, hell yeah...wtf!

Good times. Get liquored up, have a good time. 

A little slice of old time SF weirdness that still exists amongst the tech douchebags that ruined the city's character. 

Great music as the night progresses...obviously female based.... but who doesn't appreciate a little Mary J Blige once in a while. 

Head there with your friends, some dollar bills, expect to have a good time once you ease into the weird. 

Have fun. ;)
author: Jason L.

description:
You know those night when you go out with no expectations and come home the next day with a story/adventure and you've made new friends that will probably end up being in your wedding?  This is the kind of place that makes nights like those possible.

I went to Aunt Charlie's for my sisters birthday with the intention of staying for about an hour and then driving home since I had work the next morning at 8.  I ended up staying the whole night slowly nursing one of the strongest whiskey cokes I've ever had (would have enjoyed more if I didn't have to drive), while enjoying my first drag show in a pretty intimate dive bar.  

Everything was a blast.  All the ladies spanned the spectrum of style and culture and made me feel like a regular who they saw every night.  I also have to compliment the music choice for being diverse and balanced, a lot like listening to that perfect mix tape.

If you're interested in a good time any night of the week I would most definitely  recommend Aunt Charlie's, but maybe plan it so that you don't have to be hung over at work the next day ;)
author: Jason S.

description:
This was a lot of fun! The staff are awesome; the bartender puts so much booze in the drinks you only need one and very reasonably priced!
The show was really good; campy, divey atmosphere which I really like!
I'd definitely come back.
Sketchy area of town though... But overall a good experience!
author: Kelly C.

description: We came here is celebrate my birthday and had a fantastic time. The strongest martinis I have ever had in my life! So good I had to have three. If you enjoy old school drag this is the place to be. The performers were phenomenal! Bring lots of singles!
author: Kaitlyn H.

description: Don't miss out on an unforgettable night at Aunt Charlie's! We just celebrated my friends 25th birthday Saturday night, and thanks to the hotboxxx girls we had an epic ladies night. The hostess was hilarious, the music was great, and the performances were awesome. It's exactly the show for you if you're looking to dance in your seat, clap & laugh along, and really just leave the world behind for awhile. Great drinks, great prices, and free popcorn. :) Don't forget to call ahead and reserve seating at the tables in the front, definitely made enjoying the show all the better. I will definitely be back for another girls night here soon.
author: Kay S.

description: Absolutely lovely staff and show!  Great cheep drinks and crowd.  Make a reservation and bring plenty of dollar bills for the performers.  Already planning our next trip!
author: Ken P.

description: Such a great place !!!!! This gay dive bar is the best way to wind down,  or up , after a day of being the "tourist " . The regulars make you feel soooo welcome and bar tenders Jose and the delectable Minnie Minerva do a fine job and are extremely friendly . The bar manager Joe is one of the sweetest men I have ever met , I'll miss you guys so much xx . The drinks are cheap and plentiful and if that wasn't enough there are two drag shows , Minniebeing one of the stars , at the weekend for a small cover and a couple of discos a week . Be sure to go early as this is only a small bar and fills quickly. For those of you who visit after reading this review , please tell the guys that Debbie from England sends her love !!!!
author: Debbie L.

description: Took my sister in law here for her Bachelorette Night and we had a blast! Show was fantastic and the drinks are good and cheap! I definitely will be coming back! :-)
author: Catherine R.

description: I had been looking forward to visiting this place after I heard some great reviews from friends. It was a Saturday night, there was a very small cover charge of $5. Friendly staff that took care of us all night, stiff drinks for super reasonable prices and best of all, the entertainment was fabulous! I had such a great time, I'll definitely be back in the future.
author: Marina T.

description: Athough the lounge is not located in the best area of town, the club is quaint an charming - old San Franciscan feel.  The show is really good, fun, and entertaining. The MC is beautiful and talented. The entertainers (drag queens) make sure that we all have a good time and they are awesome. The downside is the bartender/manager. My group of friends and I (who make sure to tip well all the entertainers and waiter) get an unwelcoming, rude, and demeaning treatment from the bartender. The few times we've been at Aunt's Charlie the bartender embarrasses all of us by his arrogant behavior. We've decided not to go back because of him.  We'll go from now on to Diva's instead.
author: Cicero B.

description: It was just OK. We didn't stay for the hot boxxx girls and that might have increased the stars but the drinks were not good.
author: Kate L.

description: I had the best birthday there. The ladies were great! They even had the whole bar sing happy birthday to me. Of course it's in the tenderlion, but had no worries getting to and from bart. Come on, if you want super upscale, go to vegas. Definitely check it out, you will love it.
author: Shauna D.

description:
Here I am trying to give this establishment the benefit of the doubt by being a gay man patronize this drag show for the sake of a friend celebrating her bachelorette party.

Then I get followed into the bathroom stall by a performer who thinks it's acceptable to stare at my penis all up behind me. I complained, I got drinks from the manager and my waitress, and that was fine. But no amount of drinks can ever make up for such harassment and isolation I had been given, meanwhile my handsome partner was all felt up by these performers. So unwelcoming, I will never go back. I don't accept sexual harassment. No amount of alcohol will ever cure me from such unacceptable harassment. We will never return.
author: Daniel C.

description:
I loved it. Why are people expecting perfectly executed songs and/or talent? I wasn't expecting much out of sheer ignorance, but what I got was 3.50 whiskey cokes that were 99% whiskey and 1% coke, and ridiculous drag queens singing the most female-empowering songs of the past decade, who then finished up with some KESHA. 

YEAH. IT WAS AWESOME. 

Bring dollar bills and your best cat calls. And maybe some glitter.
author: Emily D.

description: If you're looking for out of the ordinary, this is you ... That's if the crackheads of the Tenderloin don't murder you before you get there ... Don't park your Benz here ‼
author: Steve W.

description:
SO MUCH FUN.

Oh man. I should start off by saying prior to my night at Aunt Charlie's, I was a drag show virgin (so maybe read this with a grain of salt?). We came on a Friday night to see the Hot Boxxx Girls. Yes, this place is in the TL, but I wouldn't say you absolutely need to take a cab. I wouldn't feel comfortable walking there alone, but it wasn't a terrible walk in a small group. The bar is tiny. Definitely make reservations. I was expecting at least a stage of some sort and more tables. Instead, it's just a rectangular room with a bar, a few tables, some benches against the wall, and a curtain at one end. 

Interesting mix of people. Quite a few straight girls, a few younger gays, and the back of the bar was full of older-skewing gay men who our cocktail waitress pointed out were "only drinking water"

Cover was only 5 bucks. Drinks were CHEAP. 2 well drinks, a shot of whiskey, and a PBR came out to 14 bucks. So you can get drunk off your ass for basically nothing. 

The Hot Boxx girls were hit or miss, but mostly amazing. There were four of them (but based on their website they must rotate?) Ronnie was freaking fabulous. She knew every lyric and paused appropriately, she had an amazing body, and could dance her ass off. I'll admit I only recognized 25% of the songs, but it was still a good time. One queen (I forgot her name but she was also the DJ) picked some strange songs and seemed a little out of it. But overall it was basically super camp, tacky at times, but so much fun. 

Don't forget your singles. Those queens deserve tips!!
author: Jon S.

description: Most unwelcoming experience in 2015. I was a frequent patron in the early 2000s. I guess this is what happens when young straight white girls are considered most valued customers. Gentrification is destroying San Francisco! RIP Ms. Vicki Marlaine!
author: Joshua A.

description: If you like divey bars, here is the place to be.
author: Kenson K.

description: We tried to go in here to meet our friends that had a table. As we walked in and paid, the employees were really angry and rude. They told us if we wanted to watch the show we would have to sit in the back and not with our friends who reserved a table. They didn't kick is out but gave us no choice but to leave. Extremely Agro and rude, at one point I thought the door guy was going to attack us when I tried to tell my friends what was going on. Avoid this establishment
author: Quest H.

description:
Tee hee. I'm still giggling about my night at Aunt Charlie's. I had NO idea what the place was like and went because they had 5 stars on Yelp. 
Took my boyfriend here and let's just say we were both a little shocked when we walked in.  Posters and pictures of penises and 80's soft gay porn on the TV's. I ain't scared of no penis hitting me in the face so on I trudge into the pit of smelly adorable 20's somethings dancing likes shits about to hit the fan!
They have killer cheap drinks served by cranky older guys. 
The DJ was phenomenal and had a 70's  funk genre playing, so It was hard not to bust a move.
The bathrooms are unisex and there is something exciting about peeing right next to a guy. It's so forbidden- I love breaking the rules!
The place was so great and cliche I can't help but love it. Everyone needs to experience Aunt Charlie's and remember NO CELL PHONES!! It ruins the experience.
author: Natasha S.

description: So much fun! Came here for my birthday with a couple of friends and we had such a blast! The drinks are so cheap and paired with a show from the hit boxx girls...your in for a treat!! Make sure to bring cash for the performers $$$
author: Daija O.

description: This place has potential but the owner seems to not care about cleaning the place up. It amazes me that with all this technology they don't accept credit cards. The gothic bouncer is very unfriendly and shows lack of interest in working there. Place is very small and the restroom looks like a coffin. I give it two stars cause of the drag queen host is very funny. I did enjoy the show.
author: Chuy E.

description:
Put this on the list of, "been there,done that, probably won't do it again though" 

We walked here and yeah let me just say that I don't suggest doing that, it's a Law & Order episode waiting to happen. We walk inside and it's a very small place with a full house, cheap drinks and some of the worst drag queens i've seen in my entire life. BUT lots of energy from most of the performers and definitely from the crowd. AND at least one of the ladies actually looked good and did a great job lip syncing to the song. We left after about an hour and a half and the party was still going strong.

If you're looking to have a very random night, by all means have at it. Enjoy!
author: Rhonda G.

description: A San Francisco institution. Entertaining show and strong drinks. Bring $$ with you because it's cash only.
author: Kim K.

description:
Strong drinks, with lots of locals. This is a Tenderloin institution. While it feels like a dive bar, and it is, you won't be disappointed. Especially not if you come to bars to drink. That is, after all, what you'll be tempted to do at Aunt Charlie's. And when you drink your bank account dry, don't worry, Aunt Charlie's is just across the street from some excellent homeless person resources. 

If you're in the area, and wanna drink, stop in here. The bar manager / owner is extremely nice, and your glass will runneth over with joy / alcohol.
author: M M.

description: This place would be so great if almost everyone that works here wasn't a huge dick. The only person that wasn't mean was the cocktail waitress. Everyone else was rude and made us feel like we should leave.
author: Tracy T.

description:
Hilarious Dream Queen Review.  Where do I start....do not walk here unless you have a gun and plan to use it.  Park close and run to car.  Now with that out of the way, let's talk about the Drag Show.  We had a reservation which gave us great bench seating up close to the stage but far enough away to see the whole thing go down.  The queen is were fun and a few of them were a bit out of touch (which made it great).  Safe to say that my favorite one had a full on beard!  She was fabulous!!

Worth seeing but do not expect glamor or high end.  It is what a great bad show should be,.....get there now..
author: Doreen D.

description:
The first time I was here, I was so shocked at how trashy it was. Never again.

But after reading about the drag show on Wednesdays, I went there again. This time it was much better. There were nice people and fun drag queens. Cheap beer and very relaxed.
author: Jesper H.

description: WTF.  You need a reservation to get a seat on Friday?  SF what have you become.  This used to be a gay bar
author: Glenn E.

description:
5 bucks gets you a two hour drag show - not a bad deal. Some of the ladies were better than others, it's not the best show I've been to. But it's good entertainment. 

Note that the place is in a really sketchy part of town - take cabs.
author: Eli A.

description:
Have you ever wondered what it would be like if you took a slightly skeezy gay bar from the mid-70s, left it untouched by anything for 40 years, and then visited it in 2012?  Wonder no more!

A friend and I went to see the Hot Boxxx Girls last weekend.  We had no reservations, but showed up about an hour early.  The girls were great, but the most memorable bit was overhearing one of the barflies talking about his STD history.

"Of course I've had clam-MY-dyah.  So WHAT?  Everyone's had it"

"So you get that papilloma virus.  You just get it.  WHATEVER"

To the show itself, I heartily recommend it.  The highlight was Ms. Sophillia Leggz, bringing crazy punk realness.  She should be on the next season of Drag Race.
author: Tom M.

description:
I was introduced to this establishment by a childhood friend and I don't think I've ever had that much fun at a bar (not even ones with karaoke!).  The drinks are strong, inexpensive, and you don't even have to get up to order one.  I must say it's the best service I've ever had at a bar.  It's also BARTable but we took advantage of the nearby parking so we didn't have to leave before the show was over. 

Some tips:
1. Call ahead and reserve a table.  The place is small and it's hard to tell if it will be a busy or slow night.  (We've experienced both.)
2. Bring extra dollars for the performers.  Drag is expensive.
3. When going to the bathroom be sure to walk around the curtain and not through it.  There is a women's bathroom. It is the one with the door on it.
author: Emily J.

description:
I took my husband and his sister here for my husbands birthday. We read that we should take a cab hre because of the rough neighborhood. so not knowing exactly how far we were from the Lounge. We hailed a cab, which looked at us strangly, and said are you sure of the address? I said yes. def. he stops about a block away and said. well your here.. I looked out and seen the sign. Yep we were here, and took a cab a block to pay 4.00. LOL

We get to the door, where we were greeted by the person who took the $5.00 coverage charge. We walked in, and I was thinking I made a mistake. I looked to my husband who was looking around wondering where I had broug him too and what for. I let th bartender know that we had a reservation and we were taken to the darker section of the bar. we were seated and ordered our drinks with the waitress. who was absolutley great!  The show shortly started and we were entertained by some great Drag Queens. They were awsome. Really enjoyed all of them,. Loved the music. Loved the Queens. 

I plan to come back and see the other shows that they put on. However, I will becareful not to drink so much of thier Cosmo's. y husband and I had to catch the Bart back. Well we ended up on the wrong Bart, he got sick on the bart, wegot off at Ridgeport. Which we ave no idea where that is. Whee we got off to get air, where we were greeted by a woman advising us that The Bart was now closed, no more trains that night, and bascially showed our drunk asses out the side gate. We hailed a cab, and took it home to Livermore, cost us 75.00 but we made it home. 

This place was great! My husband had a great birthday, and I have the pctures to prove it. And blackmail.. LOL..

If you ever have a doubt about this place, just try it out. I be you will be happy you did.
author: Tammy N.

description:
Whaz? Guh!
I get this itchin' for bad, bad times from time to time and I wonder to places I ain't never been or thought about but this place is here and so was I.
My friends were like shovin' and bitchin' and urgin' so we were

drunk


Cheap drinks, crazy clientele, entertainment from some talented  . . .  uh, ladies. Aunt Charlie's Lounge is more than a bar it's a life waiting to happen.
author: Alexander R.

description:
For the longest time, I've done my best to avoid Aunt Charlie's, thinking that it just wouldn't be something to my par.

But the drinks here are strong enough to put hair on your chest, and cheap enough to get you tipsy without having to take too much money out of the ATM.

The bartenders here are something special...they're not rude, but they don't have to be nice to you, either. They run the place and if you treat them right, they do right by you. Yeah, they're human beings! Not corporate drones by any means.

Not the BEST place, but I definitely can give it four stars, for sure.
author: Trav M.

description: Cheap drinks, great service, unfortunately we went when some bachelor/bachelorette party was there and they were completely rude and broke all the rules. Rule number one: pay the dancers. Rule number two: don't stand in the way. Rule number three: if you break rule number two, make sure you're at least doing rule number one. There's a couple more, but those drinks were strong and I can't remember the rest.
author: Kyle N.

description:
My boyfriend and I wanted to experience a Queen show while on vacation. So, my choices were between the Tranny Shack and Aunt Charlies. Considering my boyfriend would likely not have ventured with me had I told him we were stopping at the Tranny Shack, Aunt Charlies it was! We were encouraged to make a reservation, which we did, and having never seen the venue prior to showtime, I expected a large bar. But it wasn't. It was the very definition of a hole in the wall....and we loved it! The drinks were strong and the Queens were fun! The crowd was eclectic and it was a great time. The only down side is the location, in the midst of the tenderloin, it's a rough area at night. I would highly recommend cabbing it both there and back. We love walking around downtown Chicago and Milwaukee, but San Fran at night was a different beast in their downtown area...

That being said it was a fun time and was worth checking out. Cheap drinks and a fun show!
author: Nicole S.

description:
Bachlorette party bar stop after Burbon & Branch speak easy and before getting down dancing at Swig. Not the "impromptu dance party spot "others have written about, no stage and possibly one of the strongest (yet cheapest) vodka sodas we've ever ordered but was well needed. Best part were the fellow patrons! Friendly, crazy regulars full of funny stories of (better) days past. No extra perks being the bride to be, these diva ladies are all about keeping attention on themselves during their lip-sync (most times they lip sync a song different then the music) numbers. Definitely no red carpet roll out, but fun if you know what you're getting into and dont let the Queen B at the door scare you away.  

Classic TL (tenderloin) characters. In a nutshell, pay the extra money to go to Asia SF unless you are stopping by at the end of the night or fully aware that going cheaper means it will be cheaper.
author: Jillian S.

description: Oh my god this place is beyond tragic! From the rude Rasputin looking door "man" to the sad washed up drag queens who don't even phone their performances in. Can I give this place negative stars?
author: Adam R.

description: a old time transgender dive bar in the tenderloin need i say more?
author: Leigh G.

description:
I centered my best friend's bachelorette party around the drag show at Aunt Charlie's Saloon and it was the best thing I could have done! It was beyond AMAZING! The talent and personality of the performers is unbelievable and makes for quite the evening -complete with Lady Gaga and Beyonce look alikes!  The show is literally in the middle of the bar, which is a great dive with cheap drinks and only a $5 cover for the show.  Everyone couldn't stop talking about how much fun it was for the rest of the night and pretty much the whole next day!  IT WAS LEGENDARY!

* These talented ladies dance their asses off, so make sure you bring some singles for tipping!
author: Tarrah H.

description:
Oh man.

Wound up here on accident, but I'll be damned if it wasn't the happiest accident of my life.  It was like stepping into the 1970s -- middle-aged gay men everywhere, neon lighting, and a glorious jukebox.  Their drinks are strong and their crowd is wonderful.  Everyone seems to know each other, and because of that my friend and I were intimidated at first -- but not even an hour later, we were up there dancing and chatting with pretty much everyone else at the bar that night.  Aunt Charlie's has a really inclusive and casual atmosphere that makes it seem far less grimy than other dive bars.  The bartender was super cool, too.

Sure, someone in a purple fur coat did offer my friend $200 to go down on him right then and there, and it's in a hella sketchy area of the city, but go with a group of friends and pre-arrange transportation home ahead of time ... you'll be fine.

Dat jukebox tho.
author: C W.

description: Love, love, love the drag show!  Great entertainment for a reasonable price.  Beware the cocktails. Memories varied in our party. :)  Some lapses were notable!
author: J R.

description: I came to Aunt Charlie's this past weekend for my cousin's bachelorette party and we had a blast! Lady Gaga was amazing and super funny. Drinks were cheap and delicious. I will definitely be back again!
author: Jessy R.

description: i love the disco music: it's not those songs you've heard over and over all the time...it's amazing music you've never heard but really get you FEELING IT. Great drinks too and crowd...kinda small venue, but whatever.
author: L L.

description:
I came here Thursday night with some friends for Tubesteak and have to say I had a good time despite almost midnight hitting and the DJ never came on. This bar is historic and was very nice to sit and talk to the patrons who have been going there for man many years.

The crowd was a mix of neighborhood folks and LGBT folks who had been around since the 60's. Talking to them made me smile and hearing their history and stories. The bar is small but the bartender/manager was very nice and the drinks were cheap. Only downside was the bar started to get young annoying, stuck up hipsters around 11 which ruined it for us so we left. I came here to get away from those jerk offs you see roaming the Castro and SOMA

They also have a weird "no cell phone" policy which they enforce when they darken the room with nothing but red lights (which btw make u look 5 years younger) or drag shows.

I will go back for sure :)
author: Robert Shawn W.

description:
I've been to a lot of drag shows, from NYC to Minneapolis. I've written articles about drag, I've organized shows, I've drank with drag queens before shows, and I always enjoy it. I'm not an expert, but I have a thing or two to say about good drag performances.

I have NEVER been to a show like the one I saw last Saturday at Aunt Charlie's. Is it pure talent? Not at all. Is it a big, comfortable place? Not so much. BUT. The performers are unique, and the songs are such classics and done with so much heart that it's a blast. I will remember the 80+ year-old drag queen bringing down the house with "It's All Coming Back to Me Now" by Celine Dion for a long, long time.

The drinks are cheap and strong, and the server is really fun.  If you can, reserve a table ahead of time so that you can be up front for the show. The bar is tiny, so if you don't, it might not be easy to have a nice seat. Or it'll be super empty and not a problem at all, depending on the night.

Come. Drink. Enjoy with friends. Don't be too afraid. You'll have stories to tell.
author: Justin S.

description:
I first heard about Aunt Charlie's from a a friend of mine who was berating his psychopathic ex-boss.  The ex-boss went on a hideous drunk one night, resulting in a one-after-the-other string of alcohol induced atrocities.  The crowning offense of the evening was when the psychotic boss "Went to a transvestite bar in the Tenderloin that opens at six in the morning".  The final mention sparked my interest, and another seedy bar was added to my must-check-out list...

And check it out I did one weekend day, when myself and a ladyfreind were in search of "hidden charm within the Tenderloin".  After several hours of searching we came up empty handed.  To commiserate, I suggested a quick round at Aunt Charlie's.  Myself and this lady  had a bad habit of getting comfy in a bar and extending one round into three.  This time, we didn't have that problem....

To say Aunt Charlie's was dimly lit would be an understatement.  Sunlight blared in through the entrance, but farther back in the bar it became flat-out dark....the only illumination in the place was a net of miniature Christmas lights tangled in a mesh on the ceiling.  I had a beer, but my sidekick ordered a glass of wine. The bartender, a neurotic cross-dresser who looked like Uncle Fester in a Bra, practically had to dust off the one bottle of white wine they had in the place.  Finding a corkscrew was a problem, and someone had to enlist the help of a patron-derelict to get the bottle open. 

I was nice to the bartender, but some of the other patrons weren't.  This was NOT your typical gay bar.  A collection of aging misfits at the end of the bar were making all sorts of comments to the bartender....comments that weren't funny, weren't nice, and bordered on psychological sadism. The bartender was clearly upset, and the patrons seemed to take an eerie satisfaction in this.  Two stools down towards the door, a couple more crusty drifters  were eyeballing the two of us.  One was flashing us a dated "Hey babe, my place or yours" smile, while the other looked like a connection for anything from a  .45 automatic to a dime-bag of China White.

I've been in quite a few dive bars during my time, and I don't say this about too many of them....this one creeped me out.  It didn't feel dangerous...but it had an *extremely* bad vibe about it.  There was seediness without charm....dysfunction without humor....and bad grunginess without a sense of tradition or history.  Even though it was daytime, I expected something along the lines of a "Trannyshack" type crowd where a drag queen would share her secrets of controlling facial hair, making a size 14 dress fit someone with a 34 inch waist, and the best places to find a set of mens size 11 pumps.  Instead, we found a dead-end alley of urban decay, a shallow trench of mental anguish  in which we were unwilling to participate, and anxious to leave...

Hidden Charm within the Tenderloin?  We didn't find it here....
author: Mike W.

description:
I have been here twice and if you average my 2 experiences, you get 3 stars. This is a super small dive bar with a lot of character. 

Thursday night is Tubesteak Connection and it was a blast. we had a great electro disco dance party in the back with smoke machines and lights controlled by switches that the dj turned on and off. Some of the best music I have heard in SF. The place was not too packed and there was a great energy, a little sexual, all dance party. The vintage porn on the bar helped too.

My other experience was a wednesday night for the Dream Queens Revue. We show up a bit early and there were 4 other people in the bar and no music at all. We get a drink and eventually some music comes on, a mix of Gaga, Ke$ha, and Katy Perry. I was kind of bothered by the bartender smoking behind the bar. At 10:20 we decided to leave since nothing was happening and it was kind of a downer (there were 3 other people at this point). The place was dark and depressing. 

I can't wait to come back on a thursday night to dance it up. I would skip wednesdays.
author: Peter V.

description: Affordable drinks and nice staff!  There is a jukebox, so pick songs you want or else you are limited to the crowd's choice.  If you want the drag show, prepare to drop some bills for tips.  The drinks are cheap, so it makes up for it.
author: Neville B.

description:
I think this might be my fave bar in all of SF maybe in all the Bay Area. 
Gay bar in the TL with some of the wackiest drag shows and great bartenders plus old skool disco. what could possibly be better?
author: Chuck F.

description:
I'm really lazy about finishing old reviews, but I just watched the documentary about Miss Gay America ("Pageant") and felt inspired to finish my story of this fabulous place.

Thank god I had a gracious and intelligent host while visiting one of my favorite cities during Valentine's Day Weekend. And, where better to spend that romantic holiday than at a slightly seedy, very divey, (dare I say sketchy?) part of the Tenderloin...drag show/bar. Oh. My. GAWD. It was sheer perfection. (Sheer also refers to the costumes.) Everything about it made me look up to the red Christmas lights strung across the bar and ask, "Are you there, God? It's me, Judy Garland."

I've seen good drag shows before, but this one takes the cake AND the cookie batter. Why? It's intimate, dark, cheap ass drinks, five dollar cover, and some of the oldest and boniest queens I've ever seen. Bring LOTS of $1 bills to tip these ladies, they deserve it. One of them (Lord, I wish I remember her name, but I had one too many hot toddies) was pushing 80, weighed maybe 95 pounds, and brought the house DOWN with her rendition of Celine Dion's "I love you" and a prop letter in her hand. I almost shed a tear every time I hear this song now.

What more can I say? Bring your close-minded relatives (naw, screw 'em, they won't appreciate it), bring only those nearest and dearest to you for this oh-so-special-SF treat.
author: Lindsey K.

description: This is an unpretentious and thoroughly entertaining bar!! Love the ladies, cheap drinks (PBR for $3? Yes please!) and the up close and personal show. Can't wait to revisit with a handful of dollar bills and make it rain to a lip-synched Celine Dion!!
author: Stef I.

description: Impromptu dance parties, stiff cheap drinks and an amoeba-shaped drag show on a Tuesday night? In. Very in. The crowd here was all smiles & a mix of old school regulars & young folks. There were make outs in the nooks and strangers kissing. If I haven't seen a happier family since the Winslows, well, let's get back soon & cut a rug Stephon Urkel.
author: Jon A.

description:
I am not a resident of SF. Like many, just a great friend of The City. I am also a married guy.....and travel often for work.

Last week, while in SF for meetings, a co-worker suggested a few places to visit for the evening: dinner in North Beach and then some after-dinner favorites (his). We were staying in Union Square (The Westin) so everything we did was either a simple cab or walk thing. 

Our dinner at Washington Square was amazing. Great vibe, great service for us, great crowd. (Will go back, often).

I had a great time @ Charlies! Hopefully you will too (no matter what gender, orientation, etc). Actually made new-friends with two guys visiting from Dallas. Drinks are priced fine. Bartenders were friendly, smiley, quick on the pour: we sat at the bar. Funky? Sure. Whatever. More importantly, those who go (locals) and those that go (tourists, straights, married, college, whatever) were having a good, good time. Heck, I'll go back just for the DJ!
author: Steve L.

description: Aunt Charlie's is awesome!! Although I would recommend that they play music at all times, at least they have a juke box. The drinks are cheap and strong and the bartender is always friendly. Every time I go there- which is pretty often- I always meet someone new and interesting to talk to. It's pretty exciting when they have their drag shows, because all the cross dressers fill the place! Overall I would recommend this place to anyone who's out for a good time and has an open mind!
author: Kiran P.

description:
Rainy night, 10 person crowd. Show started 45 minutes late. The ladies didn't know their words and couldn't keep their wigs on, which I think might be the bare-minimum criteria for a decent drag show.
No fun.
author: R F.

description: This place is a great time.  Fun atmosphere, cheap beers, great performers, and popcorn!
author: Chris H.

description:
This place is awesome..super stiff and cheap drinks, fun tunes, and one of the most entertaining shows in town (talented, crazy, beautiful 'ladies' working here!). There was variety between each performer of the evening, from a 76 year old vet, to sashays and pirouettes, to the cocktail waitress giving up on lip-syncing and just walking right out the door for a smoke. Remember to bring lots of ones for this talented group!

I'm knocking a star because I wish they had better security..there was one obnoxious guy/queen who was being rude to the performers and the audience -- creeping us out and ruining the show for others. They should have kicked him out from the get-go, but I'm sure there's one of 'those' most nights here.
author: Lauren D.

description: Oh Aunt Charlies, where do i begin. We loved the sassy cocktail waitress, the $15 bottle of champagne, and the well preserved hotboxx ladies dancing like the lord was coming. Come for the show, but stay because you are too drunk to leave from the stiffest drinks in town.
author: Megan H.

description:
Note: If you choose to make out with your boyfriend while sitting at the bar at Aunt Charlie's you will be mocked by the lovely Queens who are lip synching their way up and down this narrow, dark, red piece of Tenderloin awesomeness.

HOWEVER, being mocked by a Queen is one of the more awesome experiences a fag-hag like me could possibly have.  And, all the Queens in question agreed that I had the hottest man in the bar.  (It's true, my Paranoid Android is a looker -- tall, dark, tattooed and pierced, ice blue eyes -- sorry don't mean to brag, but I have been head-over-heels for the guy for almost 10 years, hence agreeing to go for round #2 on the bf/gf thing not so long ago, which if you're wondering, is part of the reason I'm not on Yelp all that much... but, I'm rambling now and not about Aunt Charlie's, so...)

High points of AC's -- great drag queens, cheap drinks, free popcorn and true SF ambiance.  Je t'aime.
author: Kate R.

description:
Came here for New Year's Eve and had a blast. Was expecting a 'glam' show with high fashion and Lady Gaga and was happy to have experienced something a little different. I'm 23 and the only modern song that I recognized was Ke$ha's "Tik Tok"! Everything else was 'classic' stuff like Tina Turner, Whitney Houston, Madonna, and Cher. I also LOVED that they performed to Jack Off Jill, Bjork, and Feist!! We were dazzled by the costumes, which ranged from huge headpieces to a Suckerpunch-inspired outfit to a jeweled bikini.

Also: their drinks are STRONG and CHEAP! The beer is $4.50 and I'm pretty sure I got charged $3.50 for a gin and tonic. Nice.

The venue is very small, so it's an intimate setting. I wouldn't get here too early, though. I arrived at 9:00 and it was kind of depressing.

DON'T FORGET TO TIP, TIP, TIP!
author: Dor Z.

description:
If you are looking for the latest hipster place to be cool, do NOT COME here.  You have destroyed every dive on Polk Street and in the Castro with your poseur ways.  Your crowd took Kimos, the last good dive on Polk and turned it into Playland, a joint with ridiculous prices, ridiculous decor and female bartenders who are so cliche it is absurd.  Aunt Charlies is one of the last of the old time gay dives - cheap drinks and cheap entertainment.  A local crowd and good fun.  If your first thought when walking in here is, "this wouldn't be a bad place if they..." go away.  If you don't want to see slightly off drag shows, go elsewhere.  You are a straight guy who might be a little [or a lot] freaked by a slightly drunk older gay guy offering you $50 for a quickie in the bathroom, go elsewhere.  Put off by pictures of naked male bodies on the wall, go elsewhere.  Looking for a "mixologist" go to Upper Polk or the Castro.  Intimidated by real life, hard working and hard partying TL folks, go elsewhere.

No one needs another hipster place with overpriced drinks, the latest crowd who think the way to drink good scotch is to slam it down, or the type of nonsense one sees in the other hipster clubs in the City.  If you are cool with a real dive and the types of folks who go to a real dive and you are willing to be part of that scene, you will become a regular.
author: John P.

description:
For my friend's birthday we decided to head here for a show.  We called ahead, and they even reserved some seats for us! 

Super strong and cheap drinks, great shows, if you go on certain nights, and overall just a fun, not-at-all creepy atmosphere.  There is nothing like fist-pumping and lip-syncing along with Vicky Marlane to "It's All Coming Back to Me Now" to end your night.
author: Allison D.

description:
Friggin ridiculously awesome! Ebony Pearl is my personal favorite. She's glorious! 
Enjoy the decor, strong drinks and entertainment!!
author: Abbey T.

description:
These bitches rock my world!!!  This is the kind of old school drag charm that's hard to find in SF.

Gina LaDivina is a GODDESS!

Vickie Marlane is an angel.

I don't know where Collette LeGrande is more fierce;  on the stage or slingin cocktails!
author: Norm H.

description:
Sooo.... is it bad that I want to be a drag queen? Between my wig collection, my make-up kit and my boob job, oops, I mean... nevermind.

Point being, if you like drag queens, you will love Aunt Charlie's! It's the place to watch some of the longest performing (and oldest performing) ladies in the biz strut their stuff. The bar is the diviest of dives on one of the scariest blocks in the 'Loin, the catwalk is a ratty carpet and the stage is nothing to speak of, but the drinks are stiff and cheap and most importantly, these queens BRING IT.

It's straight friendly, but I gotta say, they love them some fresh young boy meat. To get serenaded by these queens is one of the greatest compliments known to man, or woman for that matter. Or at least in my case.
author: Nicole G.

description:
I want to be a drag queen. It looks like way too much fun! Sadly, I am a real woman, and could never be a drag queen, unless I pull a "Victor Victoria" and try to fool everyone.

Aunt Charlie's has an awesome drag show. Emily J. took me to this lovely little bar in the Tenderloin, and as with most things Emily J. introduces me to, I enjoyed it. I was thoroughly impressed, especially with the "lady" who is pushing 70. Many of these lovely "women" are great dancers, and their costumes are definitely fabulous. They are really nice, too! Gina LaDivina said I had "lovely B/Cs". It was such a nice compliment, especially coming from a woman with breasts as nice as hers. Check out Emily's review for some good tips, such as calling ahead for a table, and how to use the bathroom (at Aunt Charlie's, not in general).

My husband and Emily's fiance (Jac C.) are both straight and extremely manly, and they loved the show, too. My husband was a wee bit skeptical, but he ended up being very impressed with the show-woman-ship and the costumes. He said he would definitely be interested in going again. A few of the "girls" were giving him the eye, which I liked. I like it when another woman compliments my cute shoes, so why not my cute husband? (But, it has to be in a similar way, e.g. you could ask me where I got my shoes or tell me how adorable/sexy/versatile they are, but you wouldn't ask if you could make out with them sometime, and if you knew me, you certainly would not ask to borrow them.)

I plan to return with my mother and Emily J. and her mother for a mother night.

Minus half a star for the obnoxious girls who asked if they could squeeze in next to me, then sat down before I could say no, and then blocked my view. This is not the bar's fault, but as with any bar, beware of annoying drunks.
author: Rachel H.

description: Finding an authentic dive bar in a city that reeks of money and gentrification is remarkable enough, but add to that a proud history of quality, classic drag shows, and you've got a truly one-of-a-kind establishment. Come here to escape the bougie SF snobs and enjoy a cheap, strong drink with some quality people. Yes, the shows can be incredible amateurish, but that's kind of the point, don't you think? No one should come here expecting to see a Trannyshack-level production.
author: Johnny W.

description:
The first time I came here  I didn't know what to make of it. 
Old school porn was everywhere. The bar itself is cramped and small. Outside is a sea of homeless crack heads. All of this seems to add to the charm that is Aunt Charlie's. 
You don't come here looking for a snazzy new place. This place is down and dirty. A gay dive to the fullest. You run into a lot of real men... not Castro queens. I do not come here often but when I do I always have fun. Every city needs a bar like this one. Every gay needs one even more. 
Break up the monotony of your usual castro/soma bars. Get out of comfort circle and get to Aunt Charlie's!!
author: Wes P.

description: I came in thinking I was going to a huge place with an amazing stage and when I walked in I thought omg what I'd this place it looked like a regular bar with no stage and just like 6  tables. But let me tell you they have the nices people ever. They took care of us all night the performers were right in front of us it was very intimate.The announcer was super funny, performers were great they had awesome songs and costumes... All this and it was $5 to get in.. Best time on Turk street..
author: Robles E.

description: Came here for the Dream Queen Revue, every 2nd and 4th Wednesday night @ 9:30. Fun show, no cover, good drinks, good prices, friendly atmosphere. Bring many $1 bills, make a reservation if you have a group, follow Ruby's rules, and enjoy!
author: Steve G.

description:
What a hoot this place is! If you love dive bars, some old school beats like total eclipse of the heart, cheap drinks and of course some good old fashion drag you will leave Aunt Charlie's wanting more. The place is rather small so I suggest getting their around 9pm. The bartender will make you a stiff drink and it will only cost you $4.50. I almost had to ask for some more red bull because that was just how much vodka was going on. 

Onto the perfomance... it's priceless. A great group of ladies (men) ranging from their 20's to damn near 68 years old. Anyone who can rock a performance of New York New York in their 60's gets a round of applause in my book! Make sure you bring some doller bills with you to keep the ladies employed. They work hard for the money! 

I will definitely be back! The Hot Boxxx (three x's) Girls have style and grace!
author: Jen B.

description:
A very amateurish and embarrassingly bad drug queen show. Seriously. Most of the performers are old, their attire consists of a skirt/dress, fake boobs and a wig, and their number is basically lip-syncing while walking from one side of the small bar to the other. The problem is not the age, but the poor execution overall. Middle-school level kind of performance. Me and my friends were joking that we could do a better job. I appreciate the spirit of the performers, but seriously, a good drug queen show is about the character, the specific body/face/hand gestures of the artist they imitate, all the way to the details of the dresses, hair and make-up. Alternatively, some drug queens do an excellent job in bringing their own personality, but that works if they really shine and their performance is unique and truly entertaining.

The bar could be a fun place to hang-out at, but if you are looking for a good drug queen show, that's not the place.
author: G Y.

description:
3 dollar well drinks, free popcorn & drag queens who have seen better days. It's a narrow little place with red seats (love that) that reminds me of some of the old queen bars in the West Village (especially one of my favorites, Pieces), so I felt a little kinder towards this bar than the rest of the group who were pretty much ready to leave in 10 minutes. It's Zagat rated, baby. You know it's classy.

PS - An extra star for the excellent Thursday night I just had dancing to some AWESOME obscure 70s disco. The crowd is a little rougher than the Castro and frankly, I am all for that.
author: Maria D.

description:
One star for the free popcorn and the $2 pabst.

One star for the fact that a bar the size of an outhouse actually decided it was a good idea, 8 years ago, so I was told, to put on drag shows. 

Other than that this bar did not have a very good feel to it. It was dingy, but not in an "ewww, cool, this place has been around forever and is therefore sticky" way. It was just a small bar wth downtrodden cross dressing batenders and a clientelle with the personality of Larry King on Qualudes.
author: Drue C.

description: I went for their Wednesday night drag queen show, It was a blast! Like any show there were some  great performers and some not so good lol But overall I would go again. It is in the heart of the tenderloin but honest it was worth walking through there. Its a dive bar, so pretty small....but if you put in a reservation that you get pretty good seats right in front of the stage. Its not a new age gay scene its more like old guys preforming though there is a young crowd that comes :)  (I didn't make a reservation =/) but still had fun :). there's free popcorn and cheap drinks. My margarita was 4.50 and my gf's carn-vodka was 3.50 or $3...so not bad! oh and don't forget to bring singles $$$ (or ask for them at the bar) bc you MUST tip the performers :)
author: Quel H.

description: Tiny little hole in the wall.  Easy to walk or drive past and miss.  Cool interior lighting, nice staff.  Interesting Tenderloin bar.  Cool customers.  $2.75 Pabst in a can. $3.25 Bud Light bottles.  A good place to get drunk if you're a bisexual woman, gay boy, drag queen, or just want to kick it with those types.  This spot is quite unique.  Try it at least once when you are in a weird mood.  5 stars because I have no reason not to.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
I've been to plenty of trani shows. But I had never before been to one quite like the show they put on at Aunt Charlie's. 

Ordinarily, an evening in a tiny bar stuffed to the gills and kept by a bartender slower than molasses would be a recipe for a crabby Lisa. But not at Aunt Charlie's. Because I was too fixated on the greatest trani show in town. And in this town, that's saying something.

I only hope when I'm in my sixties, I look half as good as these gals. And can shake it half as well.

Oh, and it didn't really matter that I could only get the bartender's attention about once every hour and a half. He pours 'em strong enough to make the wait seem like a good idea. 

Aunt Charlie's is the hidden off-Broadway gem to the Broadway spectacle of places like The Stud; it's the place where the tortured geniuses of a more weathered and worn community get their moment to shine. 

And they look fabulous.
author: Lisa T.

description:
YICK!

Probably one star, but two for being the SEEDIEST GODDAMN PLACE I'VE EVER BEEN TO!!!
author: Rocco B.

description:
I decided to pick Aunt Charlie's- from the Yelp reviews - for my girlfriends' birthdays, since it was close to our restaurant.  I'm so glad I picked it!
The Hot Boxxx Girls are absolutely fabulous. They are amazing beautiful ladies that are there for you to worship and shower with singles, which they earn.   Love love love Gina la Divinia!  I'll be bringing more friends next time.
author: peggi p.

description:
I'm glad the people giving one and two stars for Aunt Charlies aren't getting it!  That way they won't have to come back for us to deal with their little dangerous voyage out of the Marina or Castro.  And how difficult it is to drink a PBR out of the can.  My eyes are rolling.

Aunt Charlie's is a NEIGHBORHOOD Bar - meaning it's designed for folks who live in the Tenderloin and yes - this does include some shaddy elements, and sometimes bad wigs.   But its also a colorful neighborhood that's alive with diversity and sure beats the nightlife of anything that's going on in the Castro these zzzzzz -- OH! Sorry!  I automatically become narcoleptic when I think about the Castro night life....

Anyway... The Hott Boxxx Girls on Fridays and Saturday Nights are always good.  Unfortunately said Marina chicks are making, what they'd consider very avant gard treks to the bar a little bit too often.  Its one thing to deal with a Tenderloin drunk in a Tenderloin bar.  It's another thing entirely to deal with some uppity Marina Gal stumbling around the bar.  No one needs to see that!

But much love to Aunt Charlies - long live yoU!
author: Daniel H.

description: Amazing show. Great costumes, great energy. This is a DIVE bar, but still worth going to. We really enjoyed ourselves.
author: Kelvin K.

description: We've only been here twice, both during the pride parade. Always a great time with a fun crowd. Always during the day. Perhaps I'd be a little hesitant at night given the neighborhood. But as others had said, use common sense.
author: Nobbi L.

description:
You gotta keep in mind that this place is among the diviest gay bars in the city. The "hit" in hit or miss will either be a weekly party like Tubesteak in which the tiny hallway-sized space is packed with hipster gay boys dancing to some pretty awesome obscure disco, or else you'll be there for a drag show performed by ancient divas of the more down-trodden variety. Still, as a young non-op tranny/genderqueer individual, I gotta give my respect to those who paved the way for me to be able to feel comfortable going to San Francisco straight bars all dolled-up without mace, and to be able to shop in women's clothing stores so I don't have to go through sisters's closet (albeit sometimes these experiences are still nerve-wracking).

But if you're an alcoholic like me, you'll visit this place for the "miss," and no, I don't mean my favorite drag queen or transsexual, I mean, go during the day when you need a reasonable priced and unreasonably stiff drink before heading off to band practice at San Francisco Studios next door.  

You gotta dodge the zombies with that familiar gimpy stance amidst the clouds of crack smoke, but once inside this dark little Turk Street refuge, you'll find this place pretty charming. Bartender Joe is sweet and often pours a water glass 3/4 full or more with the good stuff, then adds a splash of soda/juice. 

Hmm... guess I'm easy to please. Four stars? that's keeping in mind that this is a total dive, and compared to other dives, it's got a lot goin for it, even free food on some days (is it sundays?),  I'm always surprised the local street dwellers don't rush in for the chili or pasta salad. Instead, the bar during daylight is filled with regulars, and I see the same dozen faces literally everytime I stop in for my fix. 

Alas, there is always something missing, and here it's a pretty big one: no beer on tap!!! Why?!

FYI, bathrooms are pretty gnarly and if you're a boy you will be leered at by the regulars who are otherwise alright with a friendly vibe.
author: Tihani K.

description:
Ever wanted to take a tour through the brain of John Waters? If you said "no", may you continue to live a safe but dull life. If you said "Hell yes!" there is possibly something really wrong with you, but at least you're game. If you said "Err, sounds kinda creepy, but hell, I'll take a peek", you have the right outlook for Aunt Charlie's. Whoever created Aunt Charlie's somehow distilled the very essence of John Waters (Eau de Waters, you might say) into this seedy little jewel. Prepare yourself.

Bring lots of $1 bills for the bizarre but hugely entertaining tranny show. Hide your money somewhere clever because you're highly likely to get mugged just stepping out the front door. Come at Christmas - then the place gets really festive and you get some great lip-syncing to campy Christmas songs like "Ho, Ho, Where'd the Other Ho Go?" Don't go by yourself, because that would be weird and way less fun; and don't bring 37 friends because the place is about the size of a sardine can.
author: Andy M.

description:
five stars. NO SIX. wait, maybe more. can i take stars from other places and bring them here?

a small narrow venue, but totally kitschy amazing decor. there were lights all over the ceiling that gave the place what i want to call an ethereal glow, but really was more miami vice. whatever, i loved it.

$5 cover to see the Hot Boxxx Girls, but I would have paid more, especially considering how cheap the drinks were. first round was 7 drinks, and it was under $30. 

now the drag show: i have never been so entertained. the ladies of the show are not the goddesses of AsiaSF, but they are goddesses just the same. Gina LaDivina is my hero, and when i grow up, i want to be just like her. GOWNS AND ALL. in fact, if she has an estate sale, I hope she calls me.

After the show they cranked up the music and we danced until we dropped. I had an amazing time. 

The women's bathroom is behind the curtain and around the corner- the first bathroom you see is the men's room, and it's scary. 

I can see how this place might get old if you went often, but for out of towners it's a blast. a good place to take your guests for a wild night.
author: Kendra H.

description:
For this weeknight-focused t-gal, the 2nd & 4th Wednesday of the month drag shows at Aunt Charlie's are a great choice!

Have been going, off and on, for over six months, and got a happy surprise last night, stumbling upon "Christmas in July" where the ceiling lights were on, and the gloom was lightened a bit.

Cheap, stiff drinks fuel the patter between the audience, MC & the drag queens, and lots of focus on the community, and various benefit events.

Impact of the sketchy location is mitigated by using BART- only about 1.5 blocks from the Powell Street station. Though, those strong cocktails can adversely impact one's ease of riding the relative high-speed escalators, when perched on stilettos!

Every Weds. I've been there, its totally been a warm, welcoming  "tranny oasis," (more so for those of us "of a certain age")so anyone seeking an additional t-freindly SF venue would be well served, coming here! 

Bring lots of singles- the great song selection, costumes, and choreography will have you stretching them out for each number!
author: Paula J.

description:
Man, what a place. 

I came here for a drag show a couple weeks back with friends and was not disappointed. 

Upon arrival, I must admit, I was skeptical, very skeptical. Turk and Taylor, might as well be the intersection of Crack and Sketch. When i walked in it seemed kinda dead, the lighting was dim, and I was beginning to question my choice of bar for the evening. Things did not stay this way for long... 

Upon ordering my drinks, my view of this place completely changed. They were cheap and STRONG. They tasted like rubbing alcohol, 5 stars in my book! Once the show got going it was a blast. I mean, just so much fun. You realize, the drinks, the lighting, the drag queens, it all adds up. And what it adds up to is an awesome time.
author: Bobby P.

description:
Most people mistake me for a wine bar girl, and while I do heart vino, it's dive bars that really speak to me. Unfortunately  they also tend to have the worst wine. (The Sattelite Lounge in Seattle is the only exception to this rule, btw.)

Uncle Charlie's, alas, follows the rule. It serves, and I drank, unspeakably bad wine (from a 1.5 L bottle, which is one step up from the box I was expecting to see). 

It's divey down to the bar stools, the bathrooms reserved for sex and drugs only, and the hefty servings of drink. Local love it: it was like walking into a Cheers episode---if you imagine Cliff and Norm as aging transvestites and Woody a rambling man whose incoherence is exacerbated by excessive cocaine use.

Speaking of the trannies, the drag show Friday night  was really something. I think the performers were supposed to be 55+, but they didn't look a day past 40. Lovely job, ladies. 

(N.B. If you're there just for the drag show, you'll be expected to pony up an additional $5, which, given the staggeringly low cost of drinks, is perfectly acceptable, but if you're there just to drink, you need not pay.)
author: Kathleen G.

description: Please! A little red-lit hallway that smells like balls and costs $5 to enter on a Thursday? Why would you? I guess I WAS alone and awkward, but still...
author: Kaleb S.

description:
What an experience!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Not because it's a gay bar.  Okay, yes because it's a gay bar and I couldn't help but check out men the whole night.  They all seemed like the type of hipster guys that I could've found myself making out with.  Alas, 98 % were gay.

I heard about Aunt Charlie's through someone I met, who stood me up two Saturday's in a row.  Nonetheless, he suggested that I go on a Thursday for their Disco night. THE MUSIC WAS SLAMMIN'!

I brought two of my girlfriends with me.  We had a blast, but I left with the stench of rejection that wouldn't wash off of my halter top...

FOur STArs!!
author: Mennlay A.

description:
Holly Deville brings out my 2%! Potluck and sleaze on a Wednesday, what more can you ask? Deep in the loin, no pretense, just a good, old-fashioned dive with some big ass ladies.... Goldfrapp!

Dang, though. I was outside having a smoke and this crackhead couple (I'm sorry but that's what they were) came up to me. First, in between involuntary hoover vacuum snorts, the girl asks me for a cigarette. Then, after I light it for her, she asks me for a quarter. I said that she'd have to just settle for the cigarette (I know, perhaps not the most gracious response I could have chosen). Then the guy asks me for a cigarette, and as I hand it to him, he hands ME a QUARTER! Defies logic. Tenderlogic.
author: Nicholas E.

description:
Tragic drag queens at their best in the equally tragic, seedy bar. It's like being in an alternate universe - drunk or not - with the primarily good-looking alternagay crowd smack dab in the Tenderloin.  

Not the most diverse, but a definite good alternative than the Castro affair.  Good for talking, pre-partying, or watching old drag queens morosely belt out songs about yesteryear. It was almost cathartic.
author: I Love Beef C.

description:
In the days before there was a Lady Pestlebottom, I used to patronize this lounge on a weekly basis, particularly on Tuesday evenings (Mortimer Pestlebottom generally, but not exclusively, prefers the intimate company of men. Which is just fine for Lady Pestlebottom, who prefers the company of gentlemen who prefer the company of men). I recall jubilant music, interesting motion pictures, fine company, and a lively atmosphere.

More recently, on my birth-day, I was able to attend on a Saturday evening to see the amazing performing ladies (and one man, Bobby, who defies categorization - not quite a "drag-queen," nor a "drag-king," but something else entirely). I am generally not an aficionado of such shows, but I appreciate that it is Old-Tyme Drag. Many of the ladies are of advanced age, but surprisingly lithe and well-preserved. They tend to perform old-tyme songs, and pay personal attention to everybody in the matchbox-sized saloon. For this reason, you would be well-advised to have many dollar bills handy, or otherwise feel like an utter clotpole for not tipping the performers.

Lady Pestlebottom naturally could not resist informing the hostess that it was my birth-day, despite my protestations. The hostess of course acknowledged this publicly, but was very decorous and sweet, and I was hardly embarassed.
author: Mortimer P.

description:
Drag queens in their sixties??? Why the f not?  Hec, the drinks are strong and cheap....STRONG and CHEAP so if you like your trannies the same way...;-)  Hey I have had a couple of really fun nights here and I will be going back. After the first time, I realized it was important to come in with lotsa singles and since the drinks are so CHEAP AND STRONG , you don't mind letting lots of of the ones go and these ladies deserve 'em.

okay, they are not all in their sixties but I heard some were-don't look it though.
author: Lucy W.

description:
I went for a friend's bday party.  It is a small place with strong, cheap drinks and lovely, um, ladies.  I was one of probably 3 naturally-born women in the packed place.

Tips:  Don't walk in this neighborhood alone and bring lots of singles to give the performers as they walk by.
author: Mackenzie O.

description: Go DJ Bus Station turn this party on its ear two Pabst blue ribbons and a Jagermeister and I'm in the mood to dance. Think of this its early  70's in NYC Soho district with deep dirty disco... music almost everyone has sampled by now but never heard the ORIGINAL "OPULENCE, you own everything... everything is yo's"
author: RICHARD J.

description: I have only been here once so far, but the Friday night drag show was the most fun I have been to in SF.   The performers may need walkers soon, but that's half the fun.  They are still more energetic than their younger competition.
author: Russ S.

description: WHATEVER YOU DO, DON'T WALK TO THIS PLACE! You are way better off grabbing a cab or not coming here at all. Definitely cheap drinks (ordered a pineapple vodka & 3/4 of the glass was vodka) but the entertainment is off. You need to get super drunk to have a good time & the performers know it! Place is really small. Been to other drag shows & this one doesn't make it to the charts...not even close.
author: Amy M.

description:
When you're bored on a weekend night in the mood to watch a heavily-made-up-60+ year old-tranny-with-dentures-strip-cabaret, I say come here and bring lots of dollar bills. It'll change your life a little bit.

Not that it matters much because five minutes after you leave you'll be stabbed and mugged by the crackheads and left for dead anyway. 

just kidding.

But you'll WISH that that had happened because before long you'll realize that the 200-proof all-well-booze drinks they poured had just left you blind and with massive liver failure minutes after you leave. 

Retarded Strong Drinks. Weird entertainment.
author: Edward P.

description:
I love this place, my friend  Richard has an every other Tuesday night party there called Hold yr Horses that is so fun and free from all of the hipster bs so prevalent in SF. He also plays really good music.
Barry, who bar tends on Tues nights and I think Saturday too, is one of the most quality people you'll ever meet.  As an added bonus he makes one of the stiffest drinks in the TL.
author: Lisa T.

description:
I love, love, LOVE Aunt Charlie's.  It is one of my favorite bars, not only in San Francisco, but anywhere.  Yes, it's a dive bar.  That is part of it's charm.
