You can get cheap, stiff drinks and sit at the bar or high top cocktail table, grab some popcorn and shoot the shit with a friend, talk to the bartender or just let your mind wander.  The weekend drag shows are an interesting mix of old-skool queens, members of the Imperial Court and gorgeous radical faerie phenoms like Jupiter.  

Thursday nights are the province of DJ Bus Station John's long-running Tubesteak Connection (now in its 6th year).  Celebrating and reviving "bath house disco," Bus Station plays little known gems that were all the rage in the underground disco scene of the 1970's but have been largely eclipsed by played out disco tunes by crossover stars like Donna Summer.  Moreover, his party celebrates a time before the internet and other forms of alienating communication, a time when you had to leave the comfort of your home to meet people.  Tubesteak invites you to get sweaty, get on the cramped dance floor and let the music move you.  

In response to Aaron T's one-star review, of Aunt Charlie's based on his visit to Tubesteak... Well, what do you say in response to such a narrow-minded perspective?  The ban on cell phones is - as far as I know - Bus Station John's policy (not the bar's), and it is specifically an attempt to keep some aspect of life and culture free from the double-edged, ubiquitous edge of non-stop social networking.  The party is something Bus Station John demands that you be PRESENT for.  I have spent plenty of time outside the bar, and it's only dangerous if you're a sophomoric douche bag who thinks the world should totally accede to his privileged expectations.  Tubesteak and Aunt Charlie's welcome a wide variety of people, but if you want to be coddled then stick to the Castro and SOMA bars you reference in your review.  You're right.  Tubesteak isn't for you, and you're not welcome.  And just because it's not your scene doesn't mean that you should wish it out of business.  

Like the performance artist Penny Arcade says... "People used to come to New York to reinvent themselves.  Now they want New York to be like where they come from."  You're in an effing CITY man... the diversity is part of the dynamism of urban life.  You don't have to like it, but don't condemn it just because it's not your thing.  Your opinion reeks of entitlement, narrow thinking and a sheltered life.  Penny has also observed that in the battle between New York and San Francisco, SF won.  Somehow a bohemian culture has managed to weather the dot-com boom and that in San Francisco there still manages to be pockets of thriving underground culture.  That is something to be celebrated.
author: Earl D.

description:
This place is probably my only excuse for venturing to the TL these days. Just the right amount of seedy combined with cheap drinks? You could get me there pretty much any night of the week.

Also, how fun are the ladies here?!
author: Brett B.

description:
I have mixed feelings about this place, mostly good.

I love the area, the tacky interior and the hysterical locals propping up the bar.  My partner and I were in the place mere minutes when we we being shrieked at by the campest person in there and being asked if we do three-ways by a man with a Patti LaBelle tattoo.

The good stuff is out of the way.

What annoyed me was when we spent hours drinking in here, went to another bar for a bit and on our return Charlie's asked us for cover.   I get a bit pissed when asked for cover into a dive bar.
author: Sean O.

description:
The Liquid Spine.

That's the professional name of the greatest performer I've ever seen.  She's probably...70? 75?  Amazing.  The 'Exile on Main Street' of drag queens.  I'll never hear 'Total Eclipse of the Heart' the same again.  If any of these useless bands of mine 'make it,' she's gonna be our opening act.  I'm kind of afraid to go back and sully the perfect display I witnessed -- what if she has an off night?  I couldn't bear it.  Jesus, could I get any more closeted?
author: J P.

description: Good, cheap drinks and great drag shows in the last truly funky gay bar in San Francisco. Note to the straight people who've been coming lately: Thank you, and I'm being sincere here, for respecting the gay energy and not turning this into Marlena's East. Not that the Marlena's straights are obnoxious, but there's a tendency for them to avoid any and all eye contact with the queers there. Let's keep Charlie's a queer bar that welcomes heterosexuals who know how to hang with homosexuals. End of lecture. Now can I buy you a drink?
author: Denny S.

description:
I have been to this place a few times with friends and every time i have had a blast. The people are real and friendly and omg, the drinks are nice, stiff, and lets not forget CHEAP. I love it.

The first time i went i was terrified of what i saw outside. But don't let that scare you away. If you are a down to earth person who doesn't want to be bothered by annoying queen tards then this is the place for you. 

Check it out, you'll get crunk on the cheap and have some nice fun conversation!
author: Antonio N.

description:
This was such a fun place. It was the best time I've had at a public venue in the city, ever! We went on Saturday night for the drag show...which was more than incredible.

One downside is their selection of beer only exists in bottles. Even though this is definitely a bad thing, I still rate it 5!!
author: Alex M.

description:
Hot Boxxx Girls on Friday and Saturday nights at Aunt Charlie's, there are not enough great things to say about you. These ladies have been around the block more times than anyone would care to count and they're more fabulous for it.

Tubesteak Connection is a great Thursday night option. Not the usual Castro crowd.

Drinks are dirt cheap at Aunt Charlie's but don't make the mistake of not taking lots of cash, because you'll need all the singles you can find to tip the performers.
author: Shane V.

description: Came down here on our first night in the city. This place is teeny, teeny, tiny, tiny!  I have NEVER seen drag done in such a small location.  That said the Queens were giving it all their gusto and we were simply delighted by the number done by a 74 yr old drag queen.  I learned two new songs that I simply MUST go find on iTunes and generally had a delightful time.  Remember to bring cash because they don't take the plastic.
author: Whryne R.

description:
Simply FAB-U-LOUS! This is an amazing and inexpensive place for a night out! The ladies of the evening are hilarious and talented. Would have given it 5 stars if it weren't for the drinks. VERY strong, and inexpensive, but nearly deadly... I managed to drink 3 (I do not recommend this) but was up all night, re-experiencing those drinks! 

We made a reservation and I was happy we did. It's a small-ish place and with a large group and reservation, they kept us very comfortable! 

I will DEFINITELY return, and I will stick to good ole' PBR in a can (can't beat it for $3!!)
author: Erin C.

description:
Best Thursday night in town.  
If you like really obscure Italo Disco, Hi NRG, Sal Soul & Garage then Thursday Night at Aunt Charlies is the best San Francisco has to offer.  DJ Bus Station John has one of the best record collections of stuff you've never heard before and won't hear anywhere else.  The venue is as close as my 25 year old ass will ever get to The Trocadero or The Paradise Garage without a time machine.  Definitely check it out for the beats, and if you're a hot young gay male, this is a good place to cruise because there's lots of eye candy about here that don't like my kind.
author: Marie S.

description:
Hands down the darkest, seediest, shadiest, tackiest place I've ever been to.  It also has the best music (Italo Disco and Post-Disco) in town every Thursday night.  Friend Mike and I grooved all night long to the greatest disco you've never heard, all the while enjoying outrageously cheap ($3.50 for a cosmo), strong drinks.

Killer music and cocktails aside, nothing about Aunt Charlie's isn't ridiculous.  Their idea of decor is hanging plants next to a poster of a man receiving oral pleasure.  Lighting effects recall a vague time in the early eighties, and you'll oooh and aaah and giggle every time DJ Bus Station John lets loose a stream of "fantasy fog".   The bartender is missing teeth and kindly told me he couldn't make a Lemon Drop as sugar would certainly "bring out the rats".  Every time my friend and I stepped outside for a fresh breath of urine-scented Tenderloin air, the bouncer advised us to stop smoking crack.  

I can't remember the last time I had so much fun on a weeknight!  Find me at Aunt Charlie's this Thursday and every Thursday for the rest of my life.  This place is San Francisco gold.
author: Karin H.

description:
To clarify, folks encourage you to bring lots of "dolla dolla billz" so that you can fold them in half longwise, and hand them to the performers as they move about this narrow space. 

More billz = more attention. 

Plus closer encounters with the liquid spine lady, who, if you're lucky, will do a little Celine routine. The one where you drive all night, and she floats by your part of the bar, leaving behind the most pleasant rose fragrance. And then pinches your cheeks. On your face, but only if you stay seated.

One more thing: don't even think about texting (yes, on your phone) in here. It's strictly forbidden.
author: Dave K.

description:
I can't remember the first time I visited Aunt Charlie's, but for a long time my old roommate and I would trek here every Tuesday night from our edge-of-the-world Sunset apartment to dance with old queens and loin hipster kids. Tuesdays used to be Suicide Tuesdays and has had many incarnations since then, but always remained a delightful way to get drunk and dance sweaty. Since then I have enjoyed Tubesteak (even as a straight woman) on Thursdays and the drag show on the weekends, of course. I live two blocks away now, and as such the Loin-y, dive bar atmosphere has lost some of it's initial novelty, but it still remains one of my favorite places in San Francisco.

Tips:
-Yes, it's a small, dingy bar. Yes, the bathrooms are scary. If that's not your thing, I don't recommend going here.
-Yes, it's a crazy block. One time above mentioned roommate and I couldn't leave because the police were having a shoot out with a drug dealer outside. The Tenderloin is a place to exercise excellent common sense. If you're going to get wasted make sure you have a designated human on hand to help you safely into a taxi.
-Bring lots of dollar bills to tip the ladies at the drag show. They work damn hard!
author: Kirsten G.

description:
Aunt Charlie's a San Francisco tradition now. The Hot Boxxx Girls shows on Friday and Saturday nights are a true treasure - campy - unfettered - zany - glamorous - boozy. 

Joe the bartender is such a great guy, and I don't say that just because he serves whisky to me. 

I have never been there outside of the Hot Boxxx Girls shows, but, I have been there extra-early, and the bar is generally just one of those bars where you drink. But, with lots of pretty lights on the ceiling. 

The Hot Boxxx Girl shows change around with different performers and different numbers, so, you can go again and again (and, boy, have I!) and have fun every time for very different reasons! 

I despair that the fenced-in parking lot next door has become a permanent rogue's gallery of derelicts and street denizens blocking the side walk and doing various bits of street transactions, but, hopefully they will move on soon.
author: Jim K.

description: Tonight I saw a short documentary about one of the drag performers at Aunt Charlies. She's 71 years old, and has a lifetime of stories to tell. So inspiring! Live long the old tyme drag!
author: Mark S.

description:
Cheap drinks, good lighting, beautiful people, and funky rhythms all found in the heart of the Tenderloin. 

I went on a Tuesday (beware the 2 buck cover!) and the music was pretty dope and the drinks were pretty stiff.
author: Brittany L.

description:
Lyfe is an adventure when you are in the TL at night. 

Last night was the best EVER! During the intermission of the show there was an almost finished documentary on some of the veteranas that have danced through the aisles of Tia Charlies. I was impressed and respected them even more, despite the fact that there have been times some of the Reinas have given me some attitude. 

Ginger Snap is mah favorite. I want her body! 

I also like seeing regulars such as Richard, the tall skinny dude wiff the rat tail. He is FUN FUN FUN!!
author: Roxane P.

description:
This place is fucking wonderful.  Drag Queens almost always cheer me up.  I was having a hard day and Wednesday night at Aunt Charlie's was the perfect cure.  The ladies were boss, and the STRONG drinks were cheap.   It was one performer's birthday... She turned 62!  There were cupcakes and great spanish power ballads.  

 Aunt Charlie's is the kinda of place that reminds me why I love San Francisco.
author: k g.

description:
*Sunday nights- they have benefits for the community and usually  serve free food- I've been there, and they always raise a good amount for local Charities!
*Tuesday night is High FANTASY- hot mixed gay, straight crowd, 3 different DJs all night, short dragish show after midnight-mixed crowd, always fun to hook- up or dance all night- always! hot!!

*Dream Queens revue-  Every 2nd and 4th Wednesday, -10 p.m.

*Thursday night's is the big night for the local gay boys-/ guys/ men. *The Tubesteak Connection* -Dark, Cruisy, cheap drinks, hot guys- no cell phone use unless outside or behind the DJ booth- just for cruisy boys- GIRLS OKAY, but really for boy/-men cruizin for "it"- Sweating always welcome on the dance floor, sidewalk sale after is awesome!

Friday and Saturday is drag show night-call them for reservations, get here before the show !Sometimes shows sell out and is standing room only in the back- 10-12 pm
author: Gabriel F.

description:
I've only been here on an off night. We first attempted a night here for Tube Steak Thursday and it looked really really fun!

Its totally divey and in the GHETTO!! I guess it helps the gays who like booze (like me!), and crack (not me...) who can score both at this locale (and from the street residents outside)

More updated review after an actual attendance for TST.
author: Rocky K.

description:
Well, the drinks are strong and it's a carefree, laid-back crowd.  Tubesteak is usually a fun Thursday night option.

However, it can be awkward to go to Aunt Charlie's during the day - because when you emerge from the dark, dark cave, the blinding sunlight can work to your disadvantage.  Picture drunk, blind gays stumbling onto the sidewalk - right in the middle of a krumping battle: all weaves and fists and spit and yelling!
author: Marcus C.

description: Cheap drinks and good music...I will definitely be back! I danced the entire time I was there. The DJ played some good funk records and the crowd was fun. Not to mention the cheap and strong drinks! Fun place for a Thursday night.
author: Lola A.

description: I LOVE Aunt Charlie's. My friend Gabe has his birthday party here every year. The drinks are stiff and cheap (or so I've heard) and the ladies are FIERCE and FABULOUS! Their outfits are amazing, their personalities are genuine and they put so much passion into their performances. You get a 2 hour non stop dragtastic rollercoaster of a show for $5 (plus singles for tipping the ladies). I totally want to go shopping with Gina LaDivina. This last time, our party of approx 20 were basically the only patrons so we felt like the show was just for us, and then the bartender was nice enough to let us hang out and drink 15 minutes past closing time. You could say that Aunt Charlie's is divey and a bit sketchy...but it's also funny, unpretentious and so much fun!
author: Lauren T.

description:
I remember the first time I walked into Aunt Charlies during Tubesteak.. i commented how it smelled like ass .  But despite the smell, the place quickly grew on me, 

Bustop John is probably one of the best DJ's in the city and  that sweet bartender with the beard, always makes me stiff drinks...and i am a whore for cheap and stiff drinks...(and a whore in other ways as well)  Tubesteak tries to relive the late 70's early 80's gay scene, and i would think it does a decent job..

i slipped in one friday.. for the drag show and it was so tragic, i loved it... john waters would be proud..  

if you are a homo or a bi boy like me..    check out tubesteak.. i think its on of the best boys night out there.. and keep your ambercrombie at home and don't wax please....
author: Georgio S.

description:
This place is fucking AMAZING. And if you don't think so, you should probably have another Long Island Iced Tea. 

I got over the dirtiness, sliminess and fright that comes with the TL when the bartender with half his teeth says oh-so-saucily "Giiiirllll, your shoes are like Mary Jane goes to whore town!!! It's your birthday? Have a cocksucker (the drink) on me!" 
Then the drag queen older than my great grandmother showed me how to really be woman right before the DJ gave me a mixed CD for my birthday. 

It's fabulous. 

(be careful walking home)
author: Regina E.

description: Now, this place is in a scary location. The look on my partners face when I drag him here is priceless... that alone is at least worth 4 stars. We always meet the nicest people here, and the bartenders know how to pour. I have never stayed late enough to catch the drag show, but I hear it is something to behold. Come to think about it, maybe we will check it out this weekend. I'll just have to make sure mr. fancy pants takes a Valium before we go....
author: Anthony K.

description: A seamy Tenderloin dive that caters to drag queens long past their prime. The low lighting hides a multitude of sins, like heavily applied pancake makeup, cheap wigs, and threadbare outfits that were out of style a couple of decades ago. Every one of them has a story, each undoubtedly sadder than the next. It would be the perfect setting for a John Waters film if it was located in Baltimore instead of here.
author: Gourmet G.

description: unbelievably  good time wish i was there right now!!!!  dj was cute, best disco music ever. i got soo wasted from getting free drink tickets all night, super cool social people made out made a new friend best vacation ever!!! wish  was there now !!
author: Nico m.

description:
wow.  aunt charlies pretty much rocked it for me.  needed a place to get our groove on during a thursday night debauchery extravaganza.  yelp recommended aunt charlies, and we were off.  
i happen to enjoy spending time in the loin.  i appreciate the community, the smells, the colorfulness and the easy access to hard drugs. 
arrived at 10:00 and it was empty.  door dude said in an hour it would be packed.  he was wrong.  in 1 hour 20 minutes the place was packed.  but in a good way.  a-you can dance with other people- crowded but not a -you have to dance with other people because your groin/breasts are squished up against them.  lots of boys and a couple ladies.  they even had a bathroom with a door.

strongest drinks i have ever been served in my life.  we're talking the amount you would pour into the drink of a cute girl your trying to sleep with. 

i will be going back to rock out on the mini dance floor.
author: Katie H.

description:
My first haiku review:

Cheap drinks and cheap boys,
Irony beards and tight jeans
All at Aunt Charlie's.
author: Chanpory R.

description: Small, seedy, filled with welcoming dragqueens.  The perfect place to plot a dirty scheme. I have my Jack and Cokes there.  The ladies are lovely.  I always leave Aunt Charlie's in a good mood -I think its the stiff drinks.
author: Anna W.

description: Maybe I am just getting old. Maybe I like places a bit run down and dirty, maybe I just like strong men and strong drinks. This bar is really nothing special at all, except that it is in the Tenderloin and I have a blast every Thursday night I have been there for "Tubesteak". Usually full of the "Alternagays", not the usual Castro crowd, and very friendly. Cheap drinks, cheap boys. What more do you need?
author: Jason D.

description: It's all about the Hot Boxx Girls! Fiercest drag queens you will ever see or meet! Cheap, stiff drinks, and fabulous queens, what more could you ask for???
author: Kelly L.

description: I don't think I would go here until well after sunset, unlike some of the other reviewers, but Aunt Charlies is fantastic!  I cant remember which nights I've gone (that's a good sign), maybe fridays?  It's a place that should only hold 25 people (maybe 15?) and when it's packed with 200, and half of them are trying to dance, you've got a great recipe for fun!  And for inadvertently rubbing crotches on the way to the bathroom.  Where one of my friends found my freshman buddy from high school sucking some guy's dick.  Anyway, it's always been super crowded and I always run into 5 old pals and at least as many old fuck buddies.  Is that gross?  I don't know anymore.
author: Scott K.

description: Such a great time! I went with a few girlfriends, looking for a good Friday night show. It totally delivered. I loved Ms. Colette, she was our bartender who also lip syncs a wonderful Kesha number. Drinks weren't steep compared to SF prices. Overall fun time.
author: Cindy A.

description: One of my friends was miffed by the $5 cover, but I thought it was a bargain for a great drag show by some tragically aged drag queens.  I felt a little guilty partaking of the spectacle (or at least, finding it somewhat tragic) but the queens still put on a helluva show.  The drinks were reasonably priced, although the space was a bit uh, narrow for the show.  It was hilarious when people had to go to the bathroom mid-performance, behind the curtain on the "stage".  We got chided a few times for blocking the aisle, and I got a stern glare for using the men's restroom (I didn't see a women's room!  Sorry!) but that's all fine.
author: Sarah D.

description: Aunt Charlies has it all, if your looking for drag queens (drag show every friday and saturday), cheap beer (2.75 bud, or the more sophisticated 3.25 PBR, virtually an import). I didn't see the drag show, which i'm rather disappointed about, because I was on a pub crawl and everyone wanted to go to the next bar. The drag queens looked like they could have put on a good show, except the guy who was 60+ who made me throw up in my mouth a little. Anyway, all in all good for a laugh, and a bit of an oasis considering the area.
author: Karl L.

description: Where else can you find a 73 year old drag queen who puts all the younger queens to shame?
author: Holly B.

description: I've only been here 3 times but every time I've gone, I've had a blast.  STRONG drinks and fabulous drag queens.  Small venue but you make do.  Just don't stand in the aisles or you'll get yelled at!  Go with a big group of friends and just relax.  It's in the tenderloin but it's well worth the trip out of the Castro, boys!  LoL
author: Dustin F.

description: Hands down, this is my favorite Tenderloin bar!  I usually end up there on weeknights after work, and it's just what I need to take the edge off.  First of all, walking in during daylight hours will cause you to think that you have lost your eye sight.  It is that dark.  All the more fun.  Lots of regulars who seem to tolerate my presence.  Thank you.  The bartender is always friendly, and mixes pretty stiff drinks.  And, yes, it's divey, but that's part of the charm.  Btw, the ladies restroom is not so female friendly.  Small price to pay.
author: Julie R.

description:
went here for my birthday and it was SO MUCH FUN. went on a Thrusday and there was a cool crowd. a mix of older Tenderloin gays and Art School boys. DJ Bus Station John spinned a some good songs. 

The drinks are under 4 dollars usually and are mostly ALL alcohol. seriously. I had to have the bartender dilute some of my drinks a few times.
author: allen j.

description: Based solely on Tubesteak Connection.  Italo disco with tons of gay men?  Hell yes, she said.  I like them because they serve me even when I'm wasted.
author: Coco D.

description:
The Polar opposite to Asia SF

I read "gem of a dive bar" and I concur. I'm a straight man who's been here many times. I may call this place a San Francisco institution since a couple of the gals are in fact  older than most SF institutions. You can literally see some of the pioneers of the biz perform here. And yes the drinks are priced and poured for people who want to get drunk fast. Don't forget your dollar bills

They lose two stars since Ginger Snap no longer performs here. Without Ginger they lost a beat to their pulse. And believe me they could've used it they're not getting any younger. Catch Ginger Snap at Deco and other fine drag establishments.
author: Brian J.

description:
The Good the Bad and the Ugly of gritty gay bars.  We didn't stay long enough to catch the cabaret act, but we did stay long enough to see the elderly, loud, drunk patrons shouting out the lyrics to whatever song was playing on the jukebox.  It's actually quite a small place, so I can't say it's great for groups, and I can't see how they shoehorn an entire cabaret show into the back area.

Not in the greatest part of town-- to say the least-- Aunt Charlie's at least matches its neighborhood.
author: Dave N.

description:
I have been looking for a drag show for months that I appreciated going to, and I have finally found my home!  Aunt Charlie's has a phenomenal staff of performers! I am having a friend come down from Portland over Halloween, and we are definitely hitting up Aunt Charlie's for sure! The drinks are good, the bartender's are good, the performers are good, what more can I say?  This place rox!  Thank you for the wonderful time!

Don B.
San Francisco
author: Don B.

description:
sorry to say i have to downgrade my rating. i went to aunt charlies for the first time in months last night. still the same great music by Bus Station John. but the crowd (with a few notable exceptions) left something to be desired. i think i'm going to have to give up on tubesteak thursdays, though the tranny show on other nights sounds like a hoot.

-- original review --

Seedy-themed fun with the musically impeccable DJ Bus Station John on Thursday nights make this a hipster haven, a nirvana alternative to the Castro. Drinks are super cheap, too! It's smack in the sketchy Tenderloin, so I'd advise taking a cab, although friends have parked on the streets many times without incident.

Tubesteak Connection (Thurs night) is definitely the night to go, it's pretty empty til just before midnight, and within 30 minutes it's wall-to-wall (with more than a few cute guys).
author: Brady W.

description: Great mixed crowd. Old guys getting down right along with the drag queens and hipster boys. Cheapest drinks in the city, and the strongest by far.
author: Derek H.

description: We visited Aunt Charlie's on a trip to visit family in the bay area about 6 months ago and had a great time!  It's not fancy, but the drinks are cheap (and strong), and entertainment is fantastic, and the crowd was warm and diverse.  Yeah, Aunt Charlie's is in a bit of a rough area in the Tenderloin, but that's part of the charm!  When we walked in, several of the locals, kindly showed us where the best seats for the show were.  The girls all gave wonderful performances and the bar service was on point!  Go ahead, give Aunt Charlie's a try!  It's a great break from other fancy-pants, over-priced evenings out in the City.
author: jamie s.

description:
Nestled grimily on a block that is Genuinely Sketch, Aunt Charlie's Lounge warmly opens its door to all who stumble in. Dimly lit to the point of squinting even in daylight, once your eyes adjust, you'll discover that you've entered a narrow railroad car of a space. A metaphysical layer of dust fondly rests on fixtures and furniture that have not been updated in decades. Yes, fellow lushes, this is a true dive bar. And with this neighborhood, one that actually smells less bad inside than outside the door. I can't believe I've been coming to this place for years now already. And each and everytime, from the patches of memory left preserved post-binge, I've always had a colorful good time.

The main man behind the bar is Joe: a grizzled, gravelly-voiced sweetheart, with a shock of white/gray hair. Joe pours my vodka crans strong. (The cranberry juice is just an obligatory cough of an afterthought into the glass.) Needless to say, the drinks are not only blindingly stiff: they are cheap cheap cheap. I especially like coming here after work, when it's relatively quiet and sparsely populated. And despite the occasional whiff of desperation from the tragic-appearing crowd of elderly gay men who like their cheap daytime booze, there is still a vibe of fun chattiness. Without a doubt, Joe goes out of his way in decorating the place for holidays and special events, which makes it often cheerier. (The upside-down Christmas village - complete with lights and trees - that suspended from the low ceiling this past year was a terrifically elaborate enterprise.)

Thursday nights are time for the very popular "Tubesteak Connection", spun by DJ Bus Station John. Vintage gay porn magazine pages cover the length of the bar. And since all objects seem to be a tad sticky at Aunt Charlie's, most every other surface as well. Curtains of glam album covers hang from above. Not only is he a genius at fleshing out the cruisy 70's/early 80's homo bathhouse era of electro-disco and funk, Bus Station John's pastiche flyer art is dead-on as well. Creatively executed and successfully in keeping with the overall 'retro urban manwhore' theme. Odd chestnuts playing on the tv screens might be "Eyes of Laura Mars", "Body Rock" or just your standard 'classic' porn flick. The bar demographic changes significantly, as the art fag thrift store crowd starts to pack the place. (It really doesn't get going til around 11:30-ish btw.) As the evening progresses and the well drinks take their toll, the vibe gets increasingly slutty and rowdy (in a good way).

Friday and Saturday nights are the utterly fantastic "Hot Boxxx Girls" drag shows, hosted by the gracious Gina LaDivina ("The $65,000 Silicone Wonder"). If you at all cherish San Francisco for its often surreal gay glamour, you owe it to yourself to check it out. With a performance roster that often resembles former NFL players decked out in sloppy drag than your stereotypically glossed 'gender illusionists', these ladies work hard for those dollar bills. Squeezing their broad-shouldered way through the narrow path that separates the bar from the mirrored wall, they have ample opportunity to grope for the cash. Parts David Lynch, John Waters and genuine flawed professionalism, I die and go to heaven at some point during any show.

I've actually turned on several of my (straight) coworkers to this place and they've fallen for it too. We try to schedule an "Auntie's Outing" every couple of months. It's a rally call we only periodically make - since there's no way any of us have ever set foot in this place without getting really really messy. It's also a great place to go to pre-Warfield show, if you wanna get your drink on (I'll say it again: cheap!) since it's right around the corner. With its melancholy regulars, riotous atmosphere - not to mention, community fundraising drives - it truly is that inviting neighborhood dive bar kinda place. Its location might probably scare off many folks from ever stepping in. Or returning. But selfishly, I'll keep it that way.
author: Sean C.

description: This place is full of dive-y goodness. 80's/90's trashy techno on Thursdays. Accompanied by porn... what else could you want?
author: Sarah T.

description: I went here for my 21'st birthday. Absolutely amazing. The Queens are amazing and sweet...the music is great...and our waiter was fantastic. The drinks were affordable and good. I wish this place was in the castro, cause the location is a little iffy...but it's worth the trip.
author: melanie f.

description: Love it!   Aunt Charlie's has this atmosphere that takes me way back.   It's a divey gem of a bar, and I really believe one day I'll walk in there and John Waters will be watching the show.
author: Ona E.

description:
ok, during the day it's questionable, BUT make your way there on fri or sat night at 10 and you will find the BEST drag show in san francisco - a delight of queens ranging from their 20's to mid 70's

vicky marlene, the lady with the liquid spine is DAZZLING, the drinks are strong and cheap - the ambience raunchy and quaint, the crowd, friendly and fun

thursday nights you will find a hip crowd of locals looking to get laid at TUBESTEAK

the bartenders are great, the shows are fabulous

5 stars!
author: John G.

description: Where do I start?  This place is pretty awesome!  The drinks are super cheap, around 3 bucks, but I'm still not convinced that something wasn't a little weird with them... either watered down or just super crappy bourbon?  Either way, they get you drunk quickly, and the hostess even brags about that.  The show was great, at some points it became a bit of a sing-a-long when the heartbreak songs of the 90's start playing.  The ladies look like they are having a great time even though I'm pretty sure they have been doing this awhile!  The location of this place makes it very interesting, the crowd was the most diverse I have ever seen yet we all shared the similar interest of Queens in costume!  Good times were had by all.
author: Jennifer C.

description: One of these days I am going to find a way to stay late enough to see the drag show until 12:30 AM and somehow get back to Berkeley. Driving is out of the question, as two of the three times I have been here I left literally seeing double. Older crowd during the daytime, except for a few younguns who enter, suddenly disappear in the back, and never return (weird). Strong and cheap drink and some of the most interesting banter you will ever hear. Just dress down for the neighborhood and don't make eye contact with anyone and you'll be fine outside.
author: Tortoise S.

description: Ever said to yourself, man, I wish there was a bar so dark, so down and dirty that just about anybody, so long as they had and wanted a cock could get laid, this is the place.  The drinks are as cheap as the decor, and stronger than the strippers on the TV.  They only turn the lights on for the stomach turning drag shows.  This bar is perfect for the crowd is attracts.  The only reason it loses a star is because its actually pretty dangerous to get there and sometimes the other clubbers can be so drunk/high that they don't realize how many times they've eblowed you in the back.  I love it, and I'll be there regularly for the rest of my natural life.
author: Mike C.

description: Not great for first timers. If you have never been to a dive or a drag show this may be too much of a shock for you. Admittedly, we are a straight small town couple- so maybe we just didn't belong here. It was a little creepy and the neighborhood was very creepy. As I said,this was our first and probably last drag show but it seemed so unpolished and second rate. I did enjoy the one who did Liza Minneli- very impressive. Mostly, this place depressed me. The cocktail waitress was moody and kind of a miss/mr lonely hearts type. The MC's jokes and chatter were lame.So, if  sleazy dives don't bother you - you may like it but it was not for us.
author: Michelle D.

description:
seedy neighborhood, dimly lit bar, local patrons and bootie shaking tunes!

what more do you want?
author: David F.

description: i just love aunt charlie 's !! i always have a ball there !! everyone is so friendly ! the best drag and charity events ! love to the hot bartender cristy cruse !
author: Ms Lady C.

description: There was a time, from about 2004-2006, when Aunt Charlie's Lounge was my home office. I would go to this Tenderloin dive bar in the early afternoon with my laptop and work on articles over an Irish coffee, while older men chattered away at the bar as cooking shows played on their TV's. Then, after a disco nap, I'd return for one of their more "underground" nighttime events such as their Hot Boxxx Girls drag show, hosted by the magnificent Gina La Divina or their bathhouse disco night Tubesteak.  I can't even remember all the hipster clubs that came and went that I showed up at each week. It was a wild time, filled with electrifying music; wigs, boas and glitter; and incredibly stiff Tequila Sunrises, poured by Joe, one of the best bartenders ever.  I guess at some point I had come and gone (maybe because everyone else started going there or maybe I had already gotten my fill) and moved on to greener pastures. However, I'll always look back on that time with tremendous nostalgia. It was great to be part of a burgeoning scene.
author: Josh R.

description: If you're open to more than your average hole-in-the-waller, Thursdays are the best night here. Sharp electro spinning, fun dancing on the cozy dance floor and an eclectic crowd... weekends bring in more queens of the tragically glam sort. Well worth a sniff!
author: Lars K.

description: All I have to say is strong drinks and a horrible atmosphere, I was sold when I walked in the door. I really want the christmas light ceiling in there. I keep on meaning to go here after work since I work a block away but keep on putting it off. I knock of one star for breaking my wallet and cutting myself on something jagged.
author: Ryan O.

description: Tubesteak is my favorite night in any bar/club in SF!  Fun bartenders, great music, non-Castro gay boys, cheap drinks.  I dance.  That's me--two or four Thursdays a month burning out the dance floor.  Or, at least enjoying the 2.50 PBR in a can.
author: Jay S.

description: Everything was going great here until someone took my friends purse. It wasn't even that crowded, so it is beyond me how we never saw it happening. Put a sad end to the night.
author: Angela C.

description: DO NOT GO HERE! First of all, I went on a thursday! Is called tubestake! Let me first say its 2010 and we allllll use cell phones and its a bar and not a theatre! I tried to text my boyfriend for a ride and they kicked me out because I was texing on my cell phone. Aparently you aren't allowed to use your cell phone in aunt charlies. You are in the heart of the tenderloin and you have to go OUTSIDE on the dangerous street and use your Smart Phone to call text someone. putting you at risk to be robbed! I would advise you to NEVER EVER go here to drink. What establishment in 2010 kickes you out for using a cell phone? Totally stupid if you ask me! Do not go here and waste your money! EVER! Just go to another more reasonable establishment and spend your hard earned money where they appricate you. A club with that location should be kissing your ass instead of kicking you out cause you text your boyfriend! STUPID! Dont' go!
author: Darren P.

description: Aunt Charlie's is a kinda rad place.  Maybe it's because I'm from Baltimore, and this place reminds me of home with it's overt trashiness and subtle scary vibe.  I got some really great quotes through the doorway when I used to practice on top of it, just from passing by; a drunk man yelling "hang on to your art supplies," a seedy drifter advertising a "free rototiller" and someone from inside the bar yelling out to me, "hey, Sandbags!" only to run out and realize that I, in fact, was not the elusive "Sandbags."  They used to have/perhaps still have this kinda hip disco dance night on Thursdays, I think it was called Tubesteak, I went a couple of times and danced and had fun listening to the DJ yell at fancy hipster girls for talking on their cellphones, and then watched friends get high on LSD and babble about Reagan, companionship, and Whole Foods.  All in all, it's a life enriching fountain of vomit, make-up, hopelessness and despair.
author: Ben V.

description: I went to aunt charlies for the first time last night.  TL queer bars are where it is at, fuck the castro and hipstered out mission.  It's a very local bar, friendly - generally middle-aged bar with lots of brash queens that are very into striking up a conversation with receptive strangers.  The drag shows were classic and when Gina or Vicki looked into my eyes I near but swooned.  I would suggest bringing lots of tipping money because it is worth it
author: Cyd N.

description: Totally hot!  I've been here before for dancing on a Thursday, and it is a great alternative to most gay bars in this city.  This last Friday I came to see the drag show.  It was awesome.  The hostess is a totally hot 72 year old drag queen.  The other performers ranged from pretty to just plain bizarre.  The show was lively and the crowd was enthusiastic.  Bring yo dolla dolla bills.  The girls readily snatched them up.  Tipping was totally worth it - after a couple of dollars spent, the hostess called me handsome.  Being declared handsome in front of a crowded bar is totally worth a couple bucks.  It's a lot less than what I have to pay my friends to call me cute.
author: t l.

description: cant wait to get back here soon, its been too long. i certainly HOPE that thursday nights are still on with 'tube steak connection'... best music ever. also, i love the dragshows...the 'lady with the liquid spine' is a true performer!
author: rachael s.

description:
probably my favorite bar in the city, and i don't even drink.

tubesteak is on thursday. you're guaranteed some good disco and hot cock. 

the hot box girls are theeeeee best on friday nights. gina la divina is like a goddess from above. she is, after all, the $60,000 woman. i took my family, who had never been to san francisco before or known much about trannydom, here on a friday. they probably had the time of their lives. 

don't go on the 2nd and 4th tuesdays. this guy rchrd oh?! has this really gay party and he is just bad news. sooog gay. if his music wasn't so good i wouldn't be friends with him. the door girl is really cunty, too.
author: parker t.

description: Fabulous. Fierce. Unforgettable! Love, Love, LOVE these ladies esp. Gina La Divina, what a classy gal. I was definitely entertained, the drinks were cheap and STRONG. The crowd was mixed and a good time was had by all. It is in the TL's (Tenderloin) which is a scary kind of place, but being an SF native, that only bothered me slightly. If you are not familiar with area, you probably shouldn't go alone but most of the crackheads are all bark and no bite anyway:) $5 cover is reasonable and bring lots of singles to tip because these ladies deserve it!
author: sara r.

description:
PURE XANADU! Other bars may have snazzier addresses. Other bars may have retracting roofs. Other bars may have patios with massage tables (or not) but NOBODY has the delicious, happy, fun energy that Aunt Charlie's does. Joe the bartender pours them thick with a sweet vibe that melts the mopey-ist moods. The Dream Girls show on the 2nd and 4th Wednesdays is the secret of the city with glammy shemales (define that as you wish and you'll always be close). Tubesteak on Thursday kicks tender boy ass- and keeps a little crusty maturity in the dark corners to keep it real. Then, there are the Hot Boxxxx Girls on Friday & Saturday. Bust your budget to TIP, TIP, TIP these girls (and Bobby!). It's the sauciest, most grin inducing show in town with amazing performers that go from 21 and retro to 73 and fresh as a petal. Killer hand made dresses to Mackie to Dior to Goodwill, dazzling numbers, flirty staff and patrons ice the cake. I never leave without a mile-wide smile. Sundays there are usually late afternoon fundraisers just to keep everybody on the up and up. They raise a LOT of money for charities that are totally underfunded. 

If you're worried about the location, get over it. I know plenty of lawyers with bigger drug habits than any of the goofy characters hanging around outside on colorful Turk Street.
author: Scout A.

description: i went to my first and only drag show here and it was fab!  tiny space, rad drag queens, fun crowd.  i even got serenaded and the drinks were good and strong.  that was a couple years ago...i keep meaning to go back.
author: Kate W.

description: when i came here, i was already drunk. but i seem to remember good popcorn, and a sleazy guy asking what my name was. i told him i couldn't remember. later i heard that the guy from gravy train!!!! was here, junx. could we possibly have danced together? curse you, drunken memory!
author: Oleya P.

description: Aunt Charlie's is a legend not to be missed. Bring your manners, your respect, because it is that good. Not fancy, not Nordstrom pissy- just good, real fun, with characters that make your dull life bloom like a flower. If you're lucky, you'll hit it on the 2nd or 4th Wednesdays for the silly, fun, talent-burbling New Dream Queens Review show which is pure joy. Fridays and Saturdays are the more known shows- the Hot Boxxx Girls- with the venerable, ever-talented Vicki Marlane. Sadly, it seems Gina LaDivina is teetering on retirement, but the show is vividly fun, bawdy, brassy hoot of a show with or without. Thursday features Bus Station John's Tubesteak Connection- the perfect meat market -even for a vegetarian. Cracking deep disco, rather 'talented' patrons. Love. All the while, Joe the bartender pours thick, smiles hard and gives the bar its spine. He's a hero. Go. Bring ones (or ask Joe for some), get the hell out of the isle, don't text, don't sing -the ladies will do that for you and let the best show in San Francisco amuse and delight you.
author: Mister P.

description: oh the memories!  i remember first time i came here and totally thought it sucked cuz i just wasn't in the mood for having driven all the way up from santa cruz to see some kind of geriatric drag show with five other middle aged drunks.  fortunately, years later my buddie donnie started draging me here for thursday night tubesteak with dj bus-station john spinning hella obscure 70s-80s disco that i ain't even heard in my life, or at least not since i was like two!  ahh, good times.  like the time i made out with a closeted kid named miles in the bathroom until closing (hey, it's not everyday that you meet someone named miles, some things stick!  he ended up being a douchebag, so whatever).  anyway, tubesteak is a pretty cool party, totally the place to go if yr into scruffy mission bisexuals with messy beards and such, though not overly pretentious, there is a level of b.s.  it's weird to see so many boys with beards these days, what is that all about?  but that ain't the point, this is the place to go if yr on a budget, cuz their drinks are so strong, and so cheap, you will be F***ed up on just two drinks, and then next thing you know, yr making out and grabbing the cock of some closeted kid in the bathroom.  and they even poor the good top shelf stuff hella tall and it ain't more than six bucks.  ahh, good times.  i mean, you can be a scruffy lookin' hipster douchebag queerboy, and meet a hotty and get laid.  i seen it happen.  man, that was some hot little blasian boy, why he was rubbin his booty all up some loser with thrift store style and in need of a shave and with no ass and not me, well...oh yeah, i was with my boyfriend that night, damnit!  haha.  but this is totally the place, cuz it's right below our practice space, so this is where we go if we're gonna catch a drink before or after, or sometimes during practice, haha.  plus they usually have food going on with their afternoon drag shows on sundays.  and there is usually the same damned barflys there every day trying to hit on you and telling about when they were young once and pretty and thing, and on and on.  oh and joe the bartender is a real sweetie, even when kicking you out of the bathroom at 2:05am.
author: eric i.
